  9897                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9898                                  
  9899                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9900                                  
  9901                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9902                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
  9903                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
  9904                                  ;
  9905                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
  9906                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9907                                  
  9908                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9909                                  
  9910                                  readbootsec:	
  9911 000006AB B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
  9912 000006AD B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
  9913 000006B0 E8C600                  		call	read_sector
  9914 000006B3 724A                    		jb	short err_ret
  9915 000006B5 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
  9916                                  
  9917                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
  9918                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
  9919                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
  9920                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
  9921                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
  9922                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
  9923                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
  9924                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
  9925                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
  9926                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
  9927                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
  9928                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
  9929                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
  9930                                  		; informations
  9931                                  
  9932                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
  9933                                  
  9934                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9935 000006B7 803E[4E01]69            		cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
  9936 000006BC 7415                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
  9937 000006BE 803E[4E01]E9            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
  9938 000006C3 740E                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
  9939 000006C5 803E[4E01]EB            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
  9940 000006CA 7531                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9941 000006CC 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
  9942 000006D1 752A                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9943                                  
  9944                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9945                                  ;
  9946                                  ;; 10/03/2019
  9947                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
  9948                                  ;;
  9949                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
  9950                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
  9951                                  ;;
  9952                                  ;;check_signature:
  9953                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
  9954                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
  9955                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
  9956                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
  9957                                  
  9958                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
  9959                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
  9960                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
  9961                                  
  9962                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9963                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:			
  9964 000006D3 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9965                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9966 000006D6 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
  9967 000006D8 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
  9968 000006DA 7521                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9969                                  
  9970                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
  9971                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
  9972                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
  9973                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
  9974                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
  9975                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
  9976                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
  9977                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
  9978                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
  9979                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
  9980                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
  9981                                  
  9982                                  checksinglesided:
  9983 000006DC A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9984 000006DF 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
  9985 000006E1 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
  9986 000006E3 A801                    		test	al, 1
  9987 000006E5 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
  9988 000006E7 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
  9989 000006ED 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
  9990 000006EF 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
  9991 000006F4 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
  9992                                  
  9993                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
  9994                                  
  9995                                  mustbeearlier:				
  9996 000006F6 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
  9997                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9998 000006FB EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
  9999                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10000                                  
 10001                                  invalidbootsec:				
 10002 000006FD 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 10003                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10004                                  movbpb_ret:
 10005                                  gooddsk:				
 10006 000006FE F8                      		clc

 10017                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10018                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10019                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10020                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10021                                  ;
 10022                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10023                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10024                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10025                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10026                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10027                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10028                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10029                                  
 10030                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10031                                  
 10032                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10033                                  movbpb:	
 10034 00000700 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 10035                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10036                                  					; sectors per unit
 10037 00000704 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 10038                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 10039                                  					; number of directory entries
 10040 00000708 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 10041                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 10042                                  					; size of drive
 10043 0000070C 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 10044                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10045                                  					; media	descriptor
 10046 00000710 A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 10047                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 10048                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 10049 00000713 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 10050                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 10051                                  					; sectors per track
 10052 00000717 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 10053                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 10054                                  					; number of heads
 10055 0000071B 803E[0A05]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 10056 00000720 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10057 00000722 E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 10058 00000725 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 10059 00000727 C606[0A05]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 10060                                  movbpb_conv:				
 10061 0000072C 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 10062 00000731 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10063 00000733 E8D411                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 10064                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10065                                  		; cf = 0
 10066                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
 10067                                  		;clc
 10068 00000736 C3                      		retn
 10069                                  
 10070                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10071                                  
 10072                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10073                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10074                                  ;by es:di.
 10075                                  
 10076                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10077                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 10078                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 10079                                  ;      the boot record information.
 10080                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 10081                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 10082                                  
 10083                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10084                                  mov_media_ids:

 10086                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 10087                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 10088 0000073C 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext

 10092 00000743 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]

 10094                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 10095 0000074B 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10096 0000074F 57                      		push	di
 10097 00000750 56                      		push	si

 10099 00000754 BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
 10100                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;

 10102 00000757 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10103 0000075A F3A4                    		rep movsb

 10125                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10126                                  
 10127                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10128                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10129                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10130                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10131                                  ; output:
 10132                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10133                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
 10134                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10135                                  
 10136                                  readfat:	
 10137                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10138                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10139 0000076C 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10140 0000076E B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10141                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10142 00000771 E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10143 00000774 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
 10144 00000776 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
 10145                                  bad_fat_ret:				
 10146 00000778 C3                      		retn
 10147                                  
 10148                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10149                                  
 10150                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10151                                  
 10152                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10153                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10154                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10155                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10156                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10157                                  ;		dh has head
 10158                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10159                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10160                                  ;
 10161                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10162                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10163                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10164                                  ;
 10165                                  ;		carry set
 10166                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10167                                  ;
 10168                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10169                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10170                                  
 10171                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10172                                  
 10173                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10174                                  read_sector:	
 10175 00000779 55                      		push	bp
 10176 0000077A BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10177 0000077D 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10178 00000781 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10179                                  rd_ret:					
 10180 00000784 06                      		push	es
 10181 00000785 1E                      		push	ds
 10182 00000786 07                      		pop	es
 10183 00000787 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10184 0000078A CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10185                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10186                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10187                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10188 0000078C 07                      		pop	es
 10189 0000078D 734A                    		jnb	short okret2

 10346                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10347                                  
 10348                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10349                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10350                                  
 10351                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10352                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 10353                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10354                                  
 10355                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10356                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10357                                  ;
 10358                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 10359                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10360                                  
 10361                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10362                                  checksingle:		
 10363 0000083B 50                      		push	ax
 10364 0000083C 53                      		push	bx
 10365 0000083D 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10366                                  
 10367                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10368                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10369                                  
 10370 00000841 F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10371 00000844 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 10372 00000846 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 10373                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10374 00000849 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10375                                  
 10376                                  
 10377                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10378                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10379                                  
 10380 0000084B 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10381                                  					; get physical drive number
 10382 0000084F 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 10383 00000850 57                      		push	di
 10384 00000851 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10385                                  scan_list:				
 10386 00000855 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10387 00000859 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10388 0000085B B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10389 0000085D 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10390 00000861 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10391 00000863 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10392 00000867 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10393 00000868 07                      		pop	es
 10394 00000869 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10395                                  
 10396                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10397                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10398                                  ; in this case.
 10399 0000086D 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 10400 00000872 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 10401                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 10402 00000874 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 10403 00000879 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 10404 0000087B 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 10405                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 10406                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 10407 0000087F 06                      		push	es
 10408 00000880 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10409 00000884 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 10410                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10411                                  					; set up sdsb
 10412 00000888 07                      		pop	es		; restore bds pointer
 10413 00000889 EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 10414                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10415                                  
 10416                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 10417                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 10418                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 10419                                  
 10420                                  not_fsetowner:				
 10421 0000088B 803E[7800]02            		cmp	byte [single], 2 ; if (single_drive_system)
 10422 00000890 7517                    		jnz	short ignore_sdsb
 10423 00000892 50                      		push	ax
 10424 00000893 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 10425 00000897 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 10426 00000899 06                      		push	es
 10427 0000089A 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10428 0000089E 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]
 10429                                  		;xchg	al, es:504h	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10430                                  					; then swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10431 000008A3 07                      		pop	es
 10432 000008A4 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; else
 10433 000008A6 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10434 000008A7 7410                    		jz	short singleret	; issue	swap_dsk_msg
 10435                                  ignore_sdsb:				
 10436 000008A9 E8800E                  		call	swpdsk
 10437 000008AC EB0B                    		jmp	short singleret
 10438                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10439                                  
 10440                                  scan_skip:	
 10441 000008AE 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]			
 10442                                  		;les	di, es:[di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 10443                                  					; go to	next bds
 10444 000008B1 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; end of list?
 10445 000008B4 759F                    		jnz	short scan_list	; ontinue until	hit end	of list
 10446 000008B6 F9                      		stc
 10447 000008B7 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 10448 000008B8 07                      		pop	es
 10449                                  
 10450                                  singleret:

 10452 000008BA 58                      		pop	ax

 10456                                  
 10457                                  baddrive:

 10459 000008BE EB02                    		jmp	short baddrive_ret

 10461

 10471                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10472                                  
 10473                                  ; 15/10/52022
 10474                                  
 10475                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10476                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 10477                                  ;
 10478                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 10479                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 10480                                  ;	cx = sector count
 10481                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 10482                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 10483                                  ;	ds = cs
 10484                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 10485                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 10486                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 10487                                  ;
 10488                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 10489                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 10490                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10491                                  
 10492                                  diskrd:	
 10493                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 10494                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10495 000008C4 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2 ; romread
 10496                                  
 10497                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10498                                  
 10499                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10500                                  diskio:
 10501 000008C9 89FB                    		mov	bx, di		; es:bx	= transfer address
 10502 000008CB 8C06[3705]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es	; save transfer	segment
 10503 000008CF E8F9FB                  		call	SetDrive
 10504 000008D2 268A4510                		mov	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 10505 000008D6 A2[1F01]                		mov	[medbyt], al
 10506                                  		;jcxz	short ioret
 10507 000008D9 E3E8                    		jcxz	ioret
 10508                                  
 10509                                  ; see if the media is formatted or not by checking the flags field in
 10510                                  ; in the bds. if it is unformatted we cannot allow i/o, so we should
 10511                                  ; go to the error exit at label unformatteddrive.
 10512                                  
 10513 000008DB 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 2
 10514                                  		;test	byte ptr es:[di+24h], 2	; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 10515                                  					; unformatted_media
 10516 000008E0 75DE                    		jnz	short unformatteddrive
 10517 000008E2 890E[2201]              		mov	[seccnt], cx	; save sector count
 10518 000008E6 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; save sp
 10519                                  
 10520                                  ; ensure that we are trying to access valid sectors on the drive
 10521                                  
 10522 000008EA 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10523 000008EC 31F6                    		xor	si, si
 10524 000008EE 01CA                    		add	dx, cx
 10525 000008F0 83D600                  		adc	si, 0
 10526 000008F3 26837D0E00              		cmp	word [es:di+0Eh], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10527                                  					; > 32 bit sector ?
 10528 000008F8 740D                    		jz	short sanity32
 10529 000008FA 83FE00                  		cmp	si, 0
 10530 000008FD 75BD                    		jnz	short baddrive
 10531 000008FF 263B550E                		cmp	dx, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10532 00000903 77B7                    		ja	short baddrive
 10533 00000905 EB12                    		jmp	short sanityok
 10534                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10535                                  
 10536                                  sanity32:				
 10537 00000907 0336[2B05]              		add	si, [start_sec_h]
 10538 0000090B 263B751D                		cmp	si, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
 10539 0000090F 7208                    		jb	short sanityok
 10540 00000911 77A9                    		ja	short baddrive
 10541 00000913 263B551B                		cmp	dx, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
 10542 00000917 77A3                    		ja	short baddrive
 10543                                  
 10544                                  sanityok:				
 10545 00000919 8B16[2B05]              		mov	dx, [start_sec_h]
 10546 0000091D 26034517                		add	ax, [es:di+17h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs]
 10547 00000921 26135519                		adc	dx, [es:di+19h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
 10548                                  
 10549                                  ; now dx;ax have the physical first sector.
 10550                                  ; since the following procedures is going to destroy ax, let's
 10551                                  ; save it temporarily to saved_word.
 10552                                  
 10553 00000925 A3[2D05]                		mov	[saved_word], ax ; save the sector number (low)
 10554                                  
 10555                                  ; set up pointer to disk base table in [dpt]. we cannot assume that iosetup
 10556                                  ; will do it because we will skip the set up stuff with hard disks.
 10557                                  
 10558 00000928 06                      		push	es
 10559 00000929 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10560 0000092D 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]
 10561                                  		;les	si, es:78h	; [es:DSKADR]
 10562                                  					; current disk parm table
 10563 00000932 8936[2D01]              		mov	[dpt], si
 10564 00000936 8C06[2F01]              		mov	[dpt+2], es
 10565 0000093A 07                      		pop	es
 10566 0000093B 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10567                                  					; fnon_removable
 10568 00000940 7510                    		jnz	short skip_setup
 10569 00000942 E8F6FE                  		call	checksingle
 10570                                  
 10571                                  ; check to see if we have previously noted a change line. the routine
 10572                                  ; returns if everything is ok. otherwise, it pops off the stack and returns
 10573                                  ; the proper error code.
 10574                                  
 10575 00000945 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; do we have changeline support?
 10576 0000094A 7403                    		jz	short diskio_nochangeline ; brif not
 10577 0000094C E8AB0E                  		call	checklatchio	; will do a sneaky pop stack return
 10578                                  					; if a disk error occurs
 10579                                  diskio_nochangeline:			
 10580 0000094F E84700                  		call	iosetup		; set up tables	and variables for i/o
 10581                                  
 10582                                  ; now the settle values are correct for the following code
 10583                                  
 10584                                  skip_setup:
 10585                                  
 10586                                  ; 32 bit sector calculation.
 10587                                  ; dx:[saved_word] = starting sector number.
 10588                                  				
 10589 00000952 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10590 00000954 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10591 00000956 26F77513                		div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10592                                  					 ; divide by sec per track
 10593 0000095A A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10594 0000095D A1[2D05]                		mov	ax, [saved_word]
 10595 00000960 26F77513                		div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10596                                  					; now, [temp_h]:ax = track #, dx = sector
 10597                                  		;inc	dl		; sector number	is 1 based.
 10598                                  		; 18/12/2022
 10599 00000964 42                      		inc	dx
 10600 00000965 8816[3101]              		mov	[cursec], dl	; save current sector
 10601 00000969 268B4D15                		mov	cx, [es:di+15h]	; es:di+BDS.heads]
 10602                                  					; get number of	heads
 10603 0000096D 50                      		push	ax
 10604 0000096E 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10605 00000970 A1[2905]                		mov	ax, [temp_h]	; divide tracks	by heads per cylinder
 10606 00000973 F7F1                    		div	cx
 10607 00000975 A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10608 00000978 58                      		pop	ax
 10609 00000979 F7F1                    		div	cx		; now, [temp_h]:ax = cylinder #, dx = head
 10610 0000097B 833E[2905]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
 10611 00000980 7714                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg
 10612 00000982 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024	; 2^10 currently maxium	for track #.
 10613 00000985 770F                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg
 10614 00000987 8816[3201]              		mov	[curhd], dl	; save current head
 10615 0000098B A3[3301]                		mov	[curtrk], ax	; save current track
 10616                                  
 10617                                  ; we are now set up for the i/o. normally, we consider the dma boundary
 10618                                  ; violations here. not true. we perform the operation as if everything is
 10619                                  ; symmetric; let the int 13 handler worry about the dma violations.
 10620

 10842                                  					; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]

 10845                                  
 10846                                  ; if we have [step_drv] set to -1, we use the slow settle time.

 10942                                  
 10943                                  ; check the error returned in ah to see if it is a soft ecc error.
 10944                                  ; if it is not we needn't do anything special. if it is a soft

 11057 00000BC0 8E06[3705]              		mov	es, [xfer_seg]
 11058 00000BC4 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK -
 11059 00000BC6 8C06[3705]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es
 11060 00000BCA 07                      		pop	es

 11064                                  notready:

 11066 00000BCD B480                    		mov	ah, 80h
 11067 00000BCF C3                      		retn
 11068                                  
 11069                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11070                                  
 11071                                  ; map error returned by rom in ah into corresponding code to be returned to
 11072                                  ; dos in al. trashes di. guaranteed to set carry.
 11073                                  
 11074                                  maperror:	
 11075 00000BD0 51                      		push	cx
 11076 00000BD1 06                      		push	es
 11077 00000BD2 1E                      		push	ds		; set es=Bios_Data
 11078 00000BD3 07                      		pop	es
 11079 00000BD4 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; put error code in al
 11080 00000BD6 A2[4401]                		mov	[lsterr], al	; terminate list with error code
 11081 00000BD9 B90900                  		mov	cx, 9		; numerr (= errout-errin)
 11082                                  					; number of possible error conditions
 11083 00000BDC BF[3C01]                		mov	di, errin	; point to error conditions
 11084 00000BDF F2AE                    		repne scasb
 11085                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11086 00000BE1 8A4508                  		mov	al, [di+8]	; [di+numerr-1]
 11087                                  					; get translation
 11088                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary ! 
 11089                                  		;db	8Ah, 85h, 8, 0	; mov al, [di+8]
 11090 00000BE4 07                      		pop	es
 11091 00000BE5 59                      		pop	cx
 11092 00000BE6 F9                      		stc			; flag error condition
 11093 00000BE7 C3                      		retn
 11094                                  
 11095                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11096                                  
 11097                                  ; set the time of last access for this drive.
 11098                                  ; this is done only for removable media. es:di -> bds
 11099                                  
 11100                                  set_tim:		
 11101 00000BE8 50                      		push	ax
 11102 00000BE9 E88EF8                  		call	GetTickCnt	; Does INT 1A ah=0 & updates daycnt
 11103                                  
 11104                                  ; we have the new time. if we see that the time has passed,
 11105                                  ; then we reset the threshold counter...
 11106                                  
 11107 00000BEC 263B5547                		cmp	dx, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
 11108 00000BF0 7506                    		jnz	short setaccess
 11109 00000BF2 263B4D49                		cmp	cx, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
 11110                                  		;jz	short done_set
 11111                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11112 00000BF6 740E                    		je	short done_set2
 11113                                  setaccess:				
 11114 00000BF8 C606[1D01]00            		mov	byte [accesscount], 0
 11115 00000BFD 26895547                		mov	[es:di+47h], dx	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
 11116 00000C01 26894D49                		mov	[es:di+49h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
 11117                                  done_set:				
 11118 00000C05 F8                      		clc
 11119                                  done_set2:		; 12/12/2022
 11120 00000C06 58                      		pop	ax
 11121 00000C07 C3                      		retn
 11122                                  
 11123                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11124                                  
 11125                                  ; this routine is called if an error occurs while formatting or verifying.
 11126                                  ; it resets the drive,and decrements the retry count.
 11127                                  ; on entry - ds:di - points to bds for the drive
 11128                                  ;	     bp    - contains retry count
 11129                                  ; on exit    flags indicate result of decrementing retry count
 11130                                  
 11131                                  again:	
 11132 00000C08 E87004                  		call	ResetDisk
 11133 00000C0B 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6
 11134 00000C0E 7402                    		jz	short dont_dec_retry_count ; If	it is a	media change error
 11135                                  					; do not decrement retry count.
 11136 00000C10 4D                      		dec	bp		; decrement retry count
 11137 00000C11 C3                      		retn
 11138                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11139                                  
 11140                                  dont_dec_retry_count:			
 11141 00000C12 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 11142 00000C14 C3                      		retn

 11248                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11249                                  ; Do_Generic_IOCtl: perform generic ioctl request
 11250                                  ;
 11251                                  ;    input: AL contains logical drive
 11252                                  ;
 11253                                  ;	functions are dispatched through a call. On return, carry indicates
 11254                                  ;	error code in al. Note::bES:b& ds undefined on return from
 11255                                  ;	subfunctions.
 11256                                  ;
 11257                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11258                                  
 11259                                  ; 11/03/2019
 11260                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11261                                  do_generic_ioctl:			; 2C7h:0C6Bh = 70h:31DBh
 11262 00000C45 E883F8                  		call	SetDrive	; ES:DI	Points to bds for drive
 11263 00000C48 06                      		push	es
 11264 00000C49 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX	Points to request header
 11265 00000C4D 26807F0D08              		cmp	byte [es:bx+0Dh], 8 ; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION]
 11266                                  					; RAWIO
 11267 00000C52 268A470E                		mov	al, [es:bx+0Eh]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MINORFUNCTION]
 11268 00000C56 07                      		pop	es
 11269 00000C57 7525                    		jnz	short IoctlFuncErr
 11270                                  
 11271                                  		; cas note: Could do the above two blocks in reverse order.
 11272                                  		; Would have to preserve al for SetDrive
 11273                                  
 11274                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11275 00000C59 BE[160C]                		mov	si, IoReadJumpTable
 11276                                  		;mov	si, 0C3Ch	; IoReadJumpTable
 11277                                  					; at 2C7h:0C3Ch	= 70h:31ACh
 11278 00000C5C A820                    		test	al, 20h		; GEN_IOCTL_FN_TST ; test of req. function
 11279 00000C5E 7503                    		jnz	short NotGenericWrite ; function is a read.
 11280                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11281 00000C60 BE[290C]                		mov	si, IoWriteJumpTable
 11282                                  		;mov	si, 0C4Fh	; IoWriteJumpTable
 11283                                  					; at 2C7h:0C4Fh	= 70h:31BFh
 11284                                  NotGenericWrite:			
 11285 00000C63 24DF                    		and	al, 0DFh	; ~GEN_IOCTL_FN_TST ; get rid of read/write bit
 11286 00000C65 2C40                    		sub	al, 40h		; offset for base function
 11287 00000C67 2E3A04                  		cmp	al, [cs:si]
 11288 00000C6A 7712                    		ja	short IoctlFuncErr
 11289 00000C6C 98                      		cbw
 11290 00000C6D D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
 11291 00000C6F 46                      		inc	si
 11292 00000C70 01C6                    		add	si, ax
 11293 00000C72 2EFF14                  		call	near [cs:si]
 11294                                  		;call	word ptr cs:[si]
 11295 00000C75 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 11296                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 11297                                  					; 2C7h:30h = 70h:25A0h
 11298 00000C7A B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Return this status in	case of	carry
 11299 00000C7C C3                      		retn			; Pass carry flag through to exit code
 11300                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11301                                  
 11302                                  		; Cmd_Error_Proc is called as a procedure and also use
 11303                                  		; as a fall through from above
 11304                                  Cmd_Error_Proc:				; 2C7h:0CA3h = 70h:3213h

 11313                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11314                                  ;**	GetDeviceParameters:
 11315                                  ;
 11316                                  ;	GetDeviceParameters implements the generic ioctl function:
 11317                                  ;	majorcode=RAWIO, minorcode=GetDeviceParameters (60h)
 11318                                  ;
 11319                                  ;	ENTRY	(ES:di) = BDS for drive
 11320                                  ;		PtrSav = long pointer to request header
 11321                                  ;	EXIT	??? BUGBUG
 11322                                  ;	USES	??? BUGBUG
 11323                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11324                                  
 11325                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11326                                  GetDeviceParameters:
 11327                                  		; Copy info from bds to the device parameters packet
 11328                                  
 11329 00000C81 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header
 11330 00000C85 C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 11331                                  					; (DS:BX) = return buffer
 11332 00000C88 268A4522                		mov	al, [es:di+34]	; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
 11333 00000C8C 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE]
 11334 00000C8F 268B4523                		mov	ax, [es:di+35]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 11335 00000C93 83E003                  		and	ax, 3		; fnon_removable+fchangeline
 11336                                  					; Mask off other bits
 11337 00000C96 894702                  		mov	[bx+2],	ax	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES]
 11338 00000C99 268B4525                		mov	ax, [es:di+37]	; [es:di+BDS.cylinders]
 11339 00000C9D 894704                  		mov	[bx+4],	ax	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS]
 11340 00000CA0 30C0                    		xor	al, al		; Set media type to default
 11341 00000CA2 884706                  		mov	[bx+6],	al	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_MEDIATYPE]
 11342                                  					
 11343                                  		; copy recommended bpb
 11344 00000CA5 8D7527                  		lea	si, [di+39]	; [di+BDS.rbytespersec]	= [di+BDS.R_BPB]
 11345 00000CA8 F60701                  		test	byte [bx], 1	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS]
 11346                                  					; BUILD_DEVICE_BPB
 11347 00000CAB 7412                    		jz	short UseBpbPresent
 11348 00000CAD 1E                      		push	ds		; Save request packet segment
 11349 00000CAE 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 11350                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 11351                                  					; 2C7h:30h = 70h:25A0h
 11352                                  					; Point back to Bios_Data
 11353 00000CB3 E885FB                  		call	checksingle
 11354 00000CB6 E83EF9                  		call	GetBp		; Build	the bpb	from scratch
 11355 00000CB9 1F                      		pop	ds		; Restore request packet segment
 11356 00000CBA 720F                    		jb	short GetParmRet
 11357 00000CBC 8D7506                  		lea	si, [di+6]	; [di+BDS.bytespersec] = [di+BSD.DP_BPB]
 11358                                  					; Use this subfield of bds instead
 11359                                  UseBpbPresent:				
 11360 00000CBF 8D7F07                  		lea	di, [bx+7]	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB]
 11361                                  					; This is where	the result goes
 11362 00000CC2 B91900                  		mov	cx, 25		; A_BPB.size - 6
 11363                                  					; For now use 'small' bpb

 11365 00000CC6 06                      		push	es

 11535                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11536                                  ; FormatTrack:
 11537                                  ; if specialfunction byte is 1,then this is a status call to see if there is
 11538                                  ; rom support for the combination of sec/trk and # of cyln,and if the
 11539                                  ; combination is legal. if specialfunction byte is 0,then format the track.
 11540                                  ;
 11541                                  ; input: ES:di points to bds for drive
 11542                                  ;
 11543                                  ; output:
 11544                                  ;	for status call:
 11545                                  ;	specialfunction byte set to:
 11546                                  ;		0 - rom support + legal combination
 11547                                  ;		1 - no rom support
 11548                                  ;		2 - illegal combination
 11549                                  ;		3 - no media present
 11550                                  ;	carry cleared.
 11551                                  ;
 11552                                  ;	for format track:
 11553                                  ;		carry set if error
 11554                                  ;
 11555                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11556                                  
 11557                                  ; 16/03/2019
 11558

 11707                                  		; Check specialfunctions to see if DO_FAST_FORMAT has been
 11708                                  		; specified if not we should go to the normal track verification
 11709                                  		; routine. If fast format has been specified we should get the
 11710                                  		; number of tracks to be verified and check it to see if it is
 11711                                  		; > 255. If it is then it is an error and we should go to

 11713                                  		; sectors per track to get the total number of sectors to be

 11819                                  
 11820                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11821                                  
 11822                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 11823                                  
 11824                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11825                                  ;
 11826                                  ; TrackIo:
 11827                                  ;    performs track read/write/verify
 11828                                  ;
 11829                                  ;   input:
 11830                                  ;      rFlag	- 2 = read
 11831                                  ;		  3 = write
 11832                                  ;		  4 = verify
 11833                                  ;      AX	- Index into track table of first sector to io
 11834                                  ;      CX	- Number of sectors to io
 11835                                  ;      Xfer_Seg:BX - Transfer address
 11836                                  ;      ES:DI	- Pointer to bds
 11837                                  ;      CurTrk	- Current cylinder
 11838                                  ;      CurHd	- Current head
 11839                                  ;
 11840                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11841                                  
 11842                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11843                                  		
 11844                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11845                                  TrackIo:	
 11846                                  					; Procedure `disk' will pop stack to
 11847 00000EF0 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; SpSav	and return if error
 11848 00000EF4 E844F9                  		call	checksingle	; Ensure correct disk is in drv
 11849 00000EF7 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1
 11850                                  					; See if we have already set	disk
 11851 00000EFC 7407                    		jz	short Dptalreadyset ; base table
 11852 00000EFE 50                      		push	ax		; set up tables	and variables for i/o
 11853 00000EFF 51                      		push	cx
 11854 00000F00 E896FA                  		call	iosetup
 11855 00000F03 59                      		pop	cx
 11856 00000F04 58                      		pop	ax
 11857                                  Dptalreadyset:				; Point si at the table entry of the			
 11858 00000F05 BE[3B05]                		mov	si, tracktable	; first sector to be io'd
 11859 00000F08 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
 11860 00000F0A D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
 11861 00000F0C 01C6                    		add	si, ax
 11862                                  
 11863                                  		; WE WANT:
 11864                                  		; CX to	be the number of times we have to loop
 11865                                  		; DX to	be the number of sectors we read on each iteration
 11866                                  		
 11867 00000F0E BA0100                  		mov	dx, 1
 11868                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11869 00000F11 26F6452308              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 8
 11870                                  		;test	word [es:di+35], 8 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 11871                                  					; good_tracklayout
 11872 00000F16 7402                    		jz	short ionextsector
 11873                                  		
 11874 00000F18 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx		; HEY! We can read all secs in one blow
 11875                                  ionextsector:				
 11876 00000F1A 51                      		push	cx
 11877 00000F1B 52                      		push	dx
 11878 00000F1C 46                      		inc	si
 11879 00000F1D 46                      		inc	si		; Skip over the	cylinder and head in
 11880                                  					; the track table
 11881 00000F1E AC                      		lodsb			; Get sector ID	from track table
 11882 00000F1F A2[3101]                		mov	[cursec], al
 11883                                  
 11884                                  		; assumptions for a fixed disk multi-track disk	i/o
 11885                                  		; 1). In the input CX (# of sectors to go) to TrackIo,
 11886                                  		;     only CL is valid.
 11887                                  		; 2). Sector size should be set	to 512 bytes.
 11888                                  		; 3). Good track layout
 11889                                  		
 11890                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11891 00000F22 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 11892                                  		;test	word [es:di+35], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 11893                                  					; fnon_removable ; Fixed disk?
 11894 00000F27 7414                    		jz	short IoRemovable ; No
 11895                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11896 00000F29 F606[2F05]80            		test	byte [multrk_flag], 80h
 11897                                  		;test	word [multrk_flag], 80h ; MULTI_TRK_ON

 11946                                  
 11947                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11948                                  ;
 11949                                  ; The sector size in bytes needs to be converted to an index value for the ibm
 11950                                  ; rom. (0=>128,1=>256,2=>512,3=>1024). It is assumed that only these values
 11951                                  ; are permissible.
 11952                                  ;
 11953                                  ; On Input   AX contains sector size in bytes
 11954                                  ; On Output  AL Contains index
 11955                                  ; All other registers preserved
 11956                                  ;
 11957                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11958                                  
 11959                                  SectSizeToSectIndex:

 11961                                  					; examine upper	byte only
 11962 00000F74 7703                    		ja	short OneK
 11963 00000F76 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; value	in AH is the index!
 11964 00000F78 C3                      		retn
 11965                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11966                                  
 11967                                  OneK:

 11969 00000F7B C3                      		retn

 12055                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 12056                                  
 12057                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12058                                  
 12059                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12060                                  ;
 12061                                  ; Set Media Type for Format
 12062                                  ; Performs the int 13 with ah = 18h to see if the medium described in the
 12063                                  ; BPB area in the BDS can be handled by the rom.
 12064                                  ; On Input, ES:DI -> current BDS.
 12065                                  ; The status of the operation is returned in AL
 12066                                  ;
 12067                                  ;	- 0 - if the support is available,and the combination is valid.
 12068                                  ;	- 1 - no rom support
 12069                                  ;	- 2 - illegal combination
 12070                                  ;	- 3 - no media present (rom support exists but cannot determine now)
 12071                                  ;
 12072                                  ; Flags also may be altered. All other registers preserved.
 12073                                  ; If the call to rom returns no error,then the current Dpt is "replaced" by
 12074                                  ; the one returned by the rom. This is Done by changing the pointer in [Dpt]
 12075                                  ; to the one returned. the original pointer to the disk base table is stored
 12076                                  ; in TempDpt, until it is restored.
 12077                                  ;
 12078                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12079                                  
 12080                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12081                                  SetMediaForFormat:	
 12082 00000FE5 51                      		push	cx
 12083 00000FE6 52                      		push	dx
 12084                                  
 12085                                  		; If we have a format error, then do not change Dpt, TempDpt.
 12086                                  		; but we need to call int 13h, ah=18h again.
 12087                                  
 12088 00000FE7 803E[3906]01            		cmp	byte [had_format_error], 1
 12089 00000FEC 7425                    		jz	short SkipSaveDskAdr
 12090 00000FEE 30C0                    		xor	al, al		; If already done return 0
 12091 00000FF0 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1
 12092 00000FF5 7502                    		jnz	short DoSetMediaForFormat
 12093 00000FF7 EB7F                    		jmp	SetMediaRet	; Media	already	set
 12094                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12095                                  
 12096                                  DoSetMediaForFormat:			
 12097 00000FF9 06                      		push	es
 12098 00000FFA 56                      		push	si
 12099 00000FFB 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]	; Point to interrupt vectors
 12100 00000FFF 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]
 12101                                  		;les	si, es:78h	; [es:DSKADR]
 12102                                  					; Get pointer to disk base table
 12103 00001004 8936[2D01]              		mov	[dpt], si
 12104 00001008 8C06[2F01]              		mov	[dpt+2], es	; Save pointer to table
 12105                                  
 12106                                  		; Initialize the head settle time to 0Fh. See the offsets
 12107                                  		; given in dskprm.inc.
 12108                                  
 12109 0000100C 26C644090F              		mov	byte [es:si+9], 0Fh ; [es:si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]

 12112                                  
 12113                                  SkipSaveDskAdr:				
 12114 00001013 268B4D25                		mov	cx, [es:di+25h]	; [es:di+BDS.cylinders]
 12115 00001017 49                      		dec	cx
 12116 00001018 80E503                  		and	ch, 3
 12117 0000101B D0CD                    		ror	ch, 1
 12118 0000101D D0CD                    		ror	ch, 1
 12119 0000101F 86E9                    		xchg	ch, cl
 12120 00001021 260A4D13                		or	cl, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 12121 00001025 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 12122 00001029 06                      		push	es
 12123 0000102A 1E                      		push	ds
 12124 0000102B 56                      		push	si
 12125 0000102C 57                      		push	di
 12126 0000102D B418                    		mov	ah, 18h
 12127 0000102F CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - SET MEDIA TYPE	FOR FORMAT (AT model 3x9,XT2,XT286,PS)
 12128                                  					; DL = drive number, CH	= lower	8 bits of number of tracks, CL = sectors per track
 12129 00001031 7233                    		jb	short FormaStatErr
 12130 00001033 803E[3906]01            		cmp	byte [had_format_error], 1
 12131 00001038 7425                    		jz	short skip_disk_base_setting
 12132 0000103A 06                      		push	es		; Save segment returned	by the rom
 12133 0000103B 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]	; Point	to interrupt vector segment
 12134 0000103F 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]
 12135                                  		;les	si, es:78h	; [es:DSKADR] (Int 1Eh)
 12136                                  					; Get current disk base	table
 12137 00001044 8936[3A06]              		mov	[tempdpt], si
 12138 00001048 8C06[3C06]              		mov	[tempdpt+2], es ; Save it
 12139 0000104C 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 12140                                  		;mov	es:78h,	di
 12141 00001050 26893E7800              		mov	[es:DSKADR], di
 12142                                  		;pop	word ptr es:7Ah	; replace with one returned by rom
 12143 00001055 268F067A00              		pop	word [es:DSKADR+2]

 12145                                  skip_disk_base_setting:

 12200                                  
 12201                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12202                                  ;
 12203                                  ; RESET THE DRIVE
 12204                                  ;
 12205                                  ; we also set [Step_Drv] to -1 to force the main disk routine to use the
 12206                                  ; slow head settle time for the next operation. this is because the reset
 12207                                  ; operation moves the head to cylinder 0,so we need to do a seek the next
 12208                                  ; time around - there is a problem with 3.5" drives in that the head does
 12209                                  ; not settle down in time,even for read operations!!
 12210                                  ;
 12211                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12212                                  
 12213                                  ResetDisk:	
 12214 0000107B 50                      		push	ax
 12215 0000107C 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1
 12216                                  					; Reset while formatting?
 12217 00001081 7505                    		jnz	short ResetDisk_cont
 12218                                  					; Then verify operation in "fmt & vrfy"
 12219 00001083 C606[3906]01            		mov	byte [had_format_error], 1 ; Might have failed.
 12220                                  ResetDisk_cont:				
 12221 00001088 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; So signals that we had a format error
 12222 0000108A CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - RESET DISK SYSTEM
 12223                                  					; DL = drive (if bit 7 is set both hard	disks and floppy disks reset)
 12224 0000108C C606[7600]FF            		mov	byte [step_drv], 0FFh ; -1
 12225                                  					; Zap up the speed
 12226 00001091 58                      		pop	ax
 12227 00001092 C3                      		retn

 12229                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 12230                                  
 12231                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12232                                  
 12233                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12234                                  ;
 12235                                  ; This routine sets up the drive parameter table with the values needed for
 12236                                  ; format,does an int 13. values in Dpt are restored after a verify is done.
 12237                                  ;
 12238                                  ; on entry  -	ES:DI - points to bds for the drive
 12239                                  ;		Xfer_Seg:BX - points to trkbuf
 12240                                  ;		AL    - number of sectors
 12241                                  ;		AH    - int 13 function code
 12242                                  ;		CL    - sector number for verify
 12243                                  ;		DS    - Bios_Data
 12244                                  ;
 12245                                  ; ON EXIT   -	DS,DI,ES,BX remain unchanged.
 12246                                  ;		AX and flags are the results of the int 13
 12247                                  ;
 12248                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12249                                  
 12250                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12251                                  ToRom:	
 12252 00001093 53                      		push	bx
 12253 00001094 56                      		push	si
 12254                                  
 12255                                  		; Compaq bug fix - check whether we are using new ROM
 12256                                  		; functionality to set up format, not merely if it exists.
 12257                                  		; This was formerly a check against [new_rom]
 12258                                  
 12259 00001095 F606[3806]01            		test	byte [media_set_for_format], 1
 12260 0000109A 7536                    		jnz	short GotValidDpt
 12261 0000109C 50                      		push	ax
 12262 0000109D 06                      		push	es		; Save bds segment
 12263 0000109E 26807D2202              		cmp	byte [es:di+22h], 2 ; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
 12264                                  					; ffSmall ; is it a 3.5" drive?
 12265 000010A3 9C                      		pushf			; (Save	the cmp	result)
 12266 000010A4 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 12267                                  		;les	si, es:78h	; Get pointer to disk base table
 12268 000010A8 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]
 12269                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:dpt, si
 12270                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:dpt+2, es ;	 Save pointer to table
 12271 000010AD 8936[2D01]              		mov	[dpt], si
 12272 000010B1 8C06[2F01]              		mov	[dpt+2], es	; Save pointer to table
 12273                                  		
 12274 000010B5 A0[3701]                		mov	al, [formt_eot]
 12275 000010B8 26884404                		mov	[es:si+4], al	; [es:si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_EOT]
 12276 000010BC A0[3B01]                		mov	al, [gap_patch]
 12277 000010BF 26884407                		mov	[es:si+7], al	; [es:si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_FORMT_GAP]
 12278                                  					; Important for	format
 12279 000010C3 26C644090F              		mov	byte [es:si+9], 0Fh ; [es:si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 12280                                  					; Assume we are	doing a	seek operation
 12281                                  					; Setup	motor start correctly for 3.5" drives
 12282 000010C8 9D                      		popf			; Get result of	earlier	cmp
 12283 000010C9 7505                    		jnz	short MotorStrtOK
 12284 000010CB 26C6440A04              		mov	byte [es:si+0Ah], 4 ; [es:si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_MOTOR_STRT]
 12285                                  MotorStrtOK:				
 12286 000010D0 07                      		pop	es		; Restore bds segment
 12287 000010D1 58                      		pop	ax
 12288                                  GotValidDpt:				
 12289 000010D2 8B16[3901]              		mov	dx, [trknum]	; Set track number
 12290 000010D6 88D5                    		mov	ch, dl		; Set low 8 bits in ch
 12291 000010D8 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; Set drive number
 12292 000010DC 8A36[3801]              		mov	dh, [hdnum]	; Set head number
 12293 000010E0 06                      		push	es		; Save bds segment
 12294 000010E1 8E06[3705]              		mov	es, [xfer_seg]
 12295 000010E5 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK -
 12296 000010E7 07                      		pop	es		; Restore bds segment
 12297 000010E8 5E                      		pop	si
 12298 000010E9 5B                      		pop	bx
 12299 000010EA C3                      		retn

 12302                                  
 12303                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 12304                                  
 12305                                  ; BIOSCODE:1124h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 12306                                  
 12307                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12308                                  ;
 12309                                  ; get the owner of the physical drive represented by the logical drive in al.
 12310                                  ; the assumption is that we **always** keep track of the owner of a drive!!
 12311                                  ; if this is not the case, the system may hang, just following the linked list.
 12312                                  ;
 12313                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12314                                  
 12315                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12316                                  ioctl_getown:
 12317 000010EB E8DDF3                  		call	SetDrive
 12318 000010EE 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 12319                                  					; Get physical drive number
 12320 000010F2 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; Get start of bds chain
 12321                                  ownloop:				
 12322 000010F6 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 12323 000010FA 7507                    		jnz	short getnextBDS
 12324                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12325 000010FC 26F6452320              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 20h
 12326                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 20h ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12327                                  					; fi_own_physical
 12328 00001101 7515                    		jnz	short exitown
 12329                                  getnextBDS:				
 12330 00001103 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 12331 00001106 EBEE                    		jmp	short ownloop
 12332                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12333                                  
 12334                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12335                                  ;
 12336                                  ; set the ownership of the physical drive represented by the logical drive
 12337                                  ; in al to al.
 12338                                  ;
 12339                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12340
