 13075                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13076                                  					; point	ds: -> Bios_Data
 13077 0000132E E8C303                  		call	install_bds
 13078 00001331 1F                      		pop	ds
 13079 00001332 07                      		pop	es
 13080 00001333 EBC7                    		jmp	short i2f_iret
 13081                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13082                                  
 13083                                  do_get_bds_vector:
 13084                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13085 00001335 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]			
 13086                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13087 0000133A C53E[1901]              		lds	di, [start_bds]
 13088                                  		;lds	di, ds:start_bds
 13089                                  ;ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022				
 13090 0000133E EBBC                    		jmp	short i2f_iret
 13091                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13092                                  
 13093                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13094                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13095                                  
 13096                                  ; WIN386 startup stuff is done here. If starting up we set our WIN386 present
 13097                                  ; flag and return instance data. If exiting, we reset the WIN386 present flag
 13098                                  ; NOTE: We assume that the BIOS int 2fh is at the bottom of the chain.
 13099                                  
 13100                                  win386call:				
 13101 00001340 1E                      		push	ds
 13102 00001341 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13103                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13104                                  					; at 2C7h:30h =	70h:25A0h
 13105 00001346 3C05                    		cmp	al, 5		; Win386_Init
 13106                                  					; is it	win386 initializing?
 13107 00001348 7410                    		jz	short Win386Init
 13108 0000134A 3C06                    		cmp	al, 6		; Win386_Exit
 13109                                  					; is it	win386 exiting?
 13110 0000134C 7523                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not, continue int2f chain
 13111                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13112 0000134E F6C201                  		test	dl, 1
 13113                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it	win386 or win286 dos extender?
 13114 00001351 751E                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 13115                                  		;and	ds:IsWin386, 0	; indicate that	win386 is not present  
 13116 00001353 8026[CE08]00            		and	byte [IsWin386], 0 
 13117 00001358 EB17                    		jmp	short win_iret
 13118                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13119                                  
 13120                                  Win386Init:	
 13121                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13122 0000135A F6C201                  		test	dl, 1			
 13123                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it win386 or win286 dos extender?
 13124 0000135D 7512                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 13125                                  		;or	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Indicate WIN386 present
 13126 0000135F 800E[CE08]01            		or	byte [IsWin386], 1
 13127                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next, bx	; Hook our structure into chain
 13128                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next+2, es
 13129 00001364 891E[9C08]              		mov	[SI_Next], bx
 13130 00001368 8C06[9E08]              		mov	[SI_Next+2], es
 13131                                  		;mov	bx, offset Win386_SI ; point ES:BX to Win386_SI
 13132 0000136C BB[9A08]                		mov	bx, Win386_SI	; 19/10/2022
 13133 0000136F 1E                      		push	ds
 13134 00001370 07                      		pop	es
 13135                                  win_iret:				
 13136 00001371 1F                      		pop	ds
 13137                                  ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022	
 13138 00001372 EB88                    		jmp	short i2f_iret	; return back up the chain
 13139                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13140                                  
 13141                                  handle_multmult:			
 13142 00001374 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1
 13143 00001376 7515                    		jnz	short try_2
 13144 00001378 1E                      		push	ds
 13145 00001379 E84700                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13146                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13147                                  		;xor	bx, bx
 13148                                  		;dec	bx
 13149 0000137C BBFFFF                  		mov	bx, 0FFFFh
 13150 0000137F 8EC3                    		mov	es, bx		; seg of HMA
 13151 00001381 89FB                    		mov	bx, di
 13152 00001383 F7D3                    		not	bx
 13153 00001385 09DB                    		or	bx, bx
 13154 00001387 7401                    		jz	short try_1
 13155 00001389 43                      		inc	bx
 13156                                  try_1:					
 13157 0000138A 1F                      		pop	ds
 13158 0000138B EBE5                    		jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13159                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13160                                  
 13161                                  try_2:					
 13162 0000138D 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; multMULTALLOCHMA
 13163 0000138F 7530                    		jnz	short try_3
 13164 00001391 1E                      		push	ds
 13165                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13166                                  		;xor	di, di
 13167                                  		;dec	di
 13168 00001392 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh	; assume not enough space
 13169 00001395 8EC7                    		mov	es, di
 13170 00001397 E82900                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13171 0000139A 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13172 0000139D 7421                    		jz	short InsuffHMA
 13173 0000139F F7DF                    		neg	di		; free space in HMA
 13174 000013A1 39FB                    		cmp	bx, di
 13175 000013A3 7605                    		jbe	short try_4
 13176                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13177                                  		;sub	di, di
 13178                                  		;dec	di
 13179 000013A5 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh
 13180 000013A8 EB16                    		jmp	short InsuffHMA
 13181                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13182                                  
 13183                                  try_4:					
 13184                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13185 000013AA 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13186 000013AE 83C30F                  		add	bx, 15
 13187                                  		;and	bx, 0FFF0h
 13188                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13189 000013B1 80E3F0                  		and	bl, 0F0h
 13190                                  		;add	ds:FreeHMAPtr, bx ; update the free pointer	
 13191 000013B4 011E[F508]              		add	[FreeHMAPtr], bx
 13192 000013B8 7506                    		jnz	short InsuffHMA
 13193 000013BA C706[F508]FFFF          		mov	word [FreeHMAPtr], 0FFFFh ; -1
 13194                                  		;mov	ds:FreeHMAPtr, 0FFFFh
 13195                                  					; no more HMA if we have wrapped
 13196                                  InsuffHMA:				
 13197 000013C0 1F                      		pop	ds
 13198                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13199                                  try_3:		
 13200 000013C1 EBAF                    		jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13201                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13202                                  
 13203                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13204                                  ;try_3:					
 13205                                  		;jmp	ii2f_iret
 13206                                  
 13207                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13208                                  
 13209                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13210                                  
 13211                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13212                                  ;
 13213                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13214                                  ;
 13215                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13216                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13217                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13218                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13219                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13220                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13221                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13222                                  ;
 13223                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13224                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13225                                  ;
 13226                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13227                                  
 13228                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13229                                  HMAPtr:
 13230 000013C3 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13231                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13232 000013C8 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13233                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13234 000013CC 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13235 000013CF 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13236 000013D1 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13237                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13238 000013D6 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13239 000013D8 FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13240                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13241 000013DC 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13242                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13243                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13244 000013E0 C3                      		retn
 13245                                  
 13246                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13247                                  
 13248                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13249                                  
 13250                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13251                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13252                                  
 13253                                  move_sector:
 13254                                  
 13255                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13256                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13257                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13258                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13259                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13260                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13261                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13262                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13263                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13264                                  ;
 13265                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13266                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13267                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13268                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13269                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13270                                  
 13271 000013E1 FC                      		cld
 13272 000013E2 51                      		push	cx
 13273 000013E3 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13274 000013E6 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13275 000013EA 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13276 000013EC 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13277 000013F0 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13278 000013F2 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13279 000013F4 59                      		pop	cx
 13280 000013F5 C3                      		retn
 13281                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13282                                  
 13283                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13284 000013F6 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13285 000013F8 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13286 000013FA 59                      		pop	cx
 13287 000013FB C3                      		retn
 13288                                  
 13289                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13290                                  
 13291                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13292                                  
 13293                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13294                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13295                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13296                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13297                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13298                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13299                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13300                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13301                                  ;
 13302                                  ; input conditions:
 13303                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13304                                  ;
 13305                                  ; output:
 13306                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13307                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13308                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13309                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13310                                  
 13311                                  check_wrap:	
 13312 000013FC 50                      		push	ax
 13313 000013FD 53                      		push	bx
 13314 000013FE 06                      		push	es
 13315 000013FF 57                      		push	di
 13316 00001400 E86E00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13317 00001403 7260                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13318                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13319 00001405 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13320                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13321 0000140A 7459                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13322 0000140C 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13323 00001410 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13324 00001412 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13325 00001415 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13326 00001417 764C                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13327 00001419 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13328                                  
 13329                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13330                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13331                                  
 13332 0000141B 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13333 0000141D 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13334                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13335 0000141F 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13336 00001420 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13337                                  					; if on	boundary
 13338                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13339                                  not_on_bound:				
 13340 00001422 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13341 00001425 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13342 00001427 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13343 00001429 40                      		inc	ax
 13344 0000142A 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13345 0000142C 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13346 0000142F 263B4515                		cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13347                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13348 00001433 7636                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13349 00001435 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13350 00001436 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13351 00001438 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13352 0000143C F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13353                                  
 13354                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13355                                  
 13356 0000143E 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13357 00001440 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13358 00001442 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13359                                  
 13360                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13361                                  
 13362 00001444 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13363 00001446 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13364 00001448 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13365                                  no_head_bound:				
 13366 00001449 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13367 0000144B 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13368 0000144C FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13369 0000144E 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13370 00001450 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13371 00001452 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13372 00001455 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13373 00001457 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13374 00001459 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13375 0000145B 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13376 0000145D 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13377 0000145F D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13378 00001461 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13379 00001463 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13380                                  no_wrap:				
 13381 00001465 F8                      		clc
 13382 00001466 5F                      		pop	di
 13383 00001467 07                      		pop	es
 13384 00001468 5B                      		pop	bx
 13385 00001469 58                      		pop	ax
 13386 0000146A C3                      		retn
 13387                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13388                                  
 13389                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13390 0000146B 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13391 0000146D FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13392 0000146F EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13393                                  
 13394                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13395                                  
 13396                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13397                                  
 13398                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13399                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13400                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13401                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13402                                  ;
 13403                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13404                                  
 13405                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13406                                  find_bds:	
 13407 00001471 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13408                                  fbds_1:					
 13409 00001475 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13410 00001479 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13411 0000147B 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13412                                  					; go to next bds
 13413 0000147E 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13414 00001481 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13415 00001483 F9                      		stc
 13416                                  fdbs_2:					
 13417 00001484 C3                      		retn
 13418                                  
 13419                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13420                                  
 13421                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13422                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13423                                  doint:
 13424                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13425 00001485 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13426                                  					; get physical drive number
 13427                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13428                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13429                                  		
 13430 00001488 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13431 0000148A 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13432 0000148C 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13433                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13434 0000148E 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13435                                  					; get request code
 13436                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13437 00001491 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13438                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13439 00001494 9D                      		popf
 13440                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13441                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13442 00001495 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13443                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13444                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13445 0000149A 9C                      		pushf
 13446                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13447 0000149B 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13448                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13449                                  dointdone:				
 13450 0000149E C3                      		retn
 13451                                  
 13452                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13453                                  
 13454                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13455                                  
 13456                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13457                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13458                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13459                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13460                                  ;
 13461                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13462                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13463                                  ;
 13464                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13465                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13466                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13467                                  
 13468                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13469                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13470                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13471                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13472                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13473                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13474                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13475                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13476                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13477                                  ;end struc
 13478                                  
 13479                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13480                                  
 13481                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13482                                  ;	ah = function
 13483                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13484                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13485                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13486                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13487                                  ;   output conditions:
 13488                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13489                                  
 13490                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13491                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13492                                  ;
 13493                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13494                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13495                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13496                                  
 13497                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13498                                  
 13499                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13500                                  
 13501 0000149F 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13502                                  
 13503                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13504                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13505                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13506                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13507                                  
 13508                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13509                                  
 13510                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13511                                  
 13512                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13513                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13514                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13515                                  
 13516                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13517 000014A3 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13518 000014A8 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13519 000014AA 53                      		push	bx
 13520 000014AB BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13521 000014AE E83804                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13522 000014B1 5B                      		pop	bx
 13523 000014B2 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13524                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13525                                  
 13526                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13527                                  
 13528                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13529                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13530                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13531                                  
 13532                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13533                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13534 000014B4 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13535 000014B6 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13536 000014B8 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13537 000014B9 51                      		push	cx
 13538 000014BA 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13539 000014BC B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13540 000014BE D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13541 000014C0 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13542 000014C4 59                      		pop	cx
 13543 000014C5 58                      		pop	ax
 13544 000014C6 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13545                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13546 000014C8 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13547 000014C9 06                      		push	es
 13548                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13549 000014CA 2EC41E[9F14]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13550                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13551                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13552 000014CF 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13553 000014D1 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13554 000014D4 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13555                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13556                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13557 000014D8 07                      		pop	es
 13558 000014D9 5B                      		pop	bx
 13559 000014DA EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13560                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13561                                  
 13562                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13563                                  
 13564                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13565                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13566                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13567                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13568                                  
 13569                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13570 000014DC 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13571                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13572 000014E1 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13573 000014E3 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13574                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13575 000014E8 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13576                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13577 000014EA 50                      		push	ax
 13578 000014EB B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13579                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13580                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13581 000014ED 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13582                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13583                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13584 000014F2 58                      		pop	ax
 13585 000014F3 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13586                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13587                                  
 13588                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13589                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13590                                  
 13591                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13592                                  
 13593                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13594                                  
 13595                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13596                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13597                                  
 13598                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13599 000014F5 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13600                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13601                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13602 000014F6 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13603                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13604                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13605                                  
 13606                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13607                                  
 13608 000014FB A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13609 000014FE 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13610 00001501 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13611                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13612                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13613 00001503 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13614 00001508 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13615                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13616                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13617                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13618 0000150A 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13619                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13620                                  		
 13621 0000150F 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13622                                  		
 13623 00001510 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13624                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13625 00001515 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13626                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13627                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13628 00001517 9D                      		popf
 13629 00001518 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13630                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13631 0000151A 1F                      		pop	ds
 13632 0000151B CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13633                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13634                                  
 13635                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13636                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13637                                  ; a changeline error.
 13638                                  
 13639                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13640 0000151E 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13641                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13642 00001520 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13643 00001523 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13644 00001525 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13645 00001527 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13646 00001529 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13647 0000152E 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13648                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13649                                  					; never	would
 13650 00001530 53                      		push	bx
 13651 00001531 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13652 00001534 E8B203                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13653 00001537 5B                      		pop	bx
 13654                                  int13b:					
 13655 00001538 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13656 00001539 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13657                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13658                                  
 13659                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13660                                  
 13661                                  goterr13:				
 13662 0000153B 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13663 0000153E 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13664                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13665 00001540 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13666 00001543 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13667 00001545 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13668 0000154A 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13669                                  
 13670 0000154C 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13671                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13672                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13673                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13674 00001551 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13675                                  
 13676 00001553 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13677                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13678                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13679 00001555 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13680                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13681                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13682 0000155A A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13683 0000155D 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13684 0000155F 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13685 00001561 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13686 00001563 53                      		push	bx
 13687 00001564 51                      		push	cx
 13688 00001565 52                      		push	dx
 13689 00001566 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13690                                  loop_ecc:				
 13691 00001569 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13692                                  
 13693                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13694                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13695                                  ;
 13696                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13697                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13698                                  ; track.
 13699                                  ;
 13700                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13701                                  ; this request.
 13702                                  ;
 13703                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13704                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13705                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13706                                  ;
 13707 0000156C E88DFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13708                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13709                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13710 0000156F 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13711                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13712 00001574 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13713 00001576 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13714 00001579 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13715 0000157B 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13716 0000157E 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13717                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13718                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13719                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13720 00001580 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13721                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13722                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13723                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13724                                  ok11_op:				
 13725 00001582 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13726 00001586 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13727 00001588 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13728                                  					; add 200h to address
 13729 0000158A FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13730 0000158C FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13731 0000158E EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13732                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13733                                  
 13734                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13735                                  
 13736                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13737 00001590 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13738                                  ok11_exit:				
 13739 00001591 5A                      		pop	dx
 13740 00001592 59                      		pop	cx
 13741 00001593 5B                      		pop	bx
 13742 00001594 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13743                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13744                                  
 13745                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13746                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13747                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13748                                  
 13749                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13750 00001596 06                      		push	es
 13751 00001597 53                      		push	bx
 13752 00001598 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13753 0000159B 1E                      		push	ds
 13754 0000159C 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13755 0000159D B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13756                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13757                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13758 000015A0 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13759                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13760 000015A5 5B                      		pop	bx
 13761 000015A6 07                      		pop	es
 13762 000015A7 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13763 000015A9 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13764 000015AC 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13765                                  
 13766                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13767                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13768                                  
 13769                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13770 000015AE 56                      		push	si
 13771 000015AF 57                      		push	di
 13772 000015B0 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13773 000015B2 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13774 000015B5 E829FE                  		call	move_sector
 13775 000015B8 5F                      		pop	di
 13776 000015B9 5E                      		pop	si
 13777 000015BA EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13778                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13779                                  
 13780                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13781                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13782                                  
 13783                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13784 000015BC A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13785 000015BF FB                      		sti
 13786 000015C0 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13787 000015C3 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13788                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13789                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13790 000015C5 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13791 000015C8 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13792 000015CA 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13793 000015CD 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13794 000015CF 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13795                                  
 13796                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13797                                  
 13798                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13799                                  
 13800 000015D1 52                      		push	dx
 13801 000015D2 51                      		push	cx
 13802 000015D3 53                      		push	bx
 13803 000015D4 50                      		push	ax
 13804 000015D5 55                      		push	bp
 13805 000015D6 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 13806 000015D8 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 13807 000015DA D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13808 000015DC D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13809 000015DE D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13810 000015E0 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 13811 000015E2 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 13812 000015E4 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 13813                                  
 13814                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 13815                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 13816                                  
 13817 000015E8 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 13818 000015EA E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 13819                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13820                                  
 13821                                  no_skip_first:				
 13822 000015ED D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 13823 000015EF B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 13824 000015F1 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 13825                                  
 13826                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 13827                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 13828                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 13829                                  ;
 13830                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 13831                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 13832                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 13833                                  ; in error.
 13834                                  
 13835 000015F3 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 13836 000015F5 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 13837                                  
 13838                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 13839                                  
 13840 000015F7 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13841                                  					; set up head number
 13842 000015FA E888FE                  		call	doint
 13843 000015FD E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 13844                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13845                                  
 13846                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 13847 00001600 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 13848 00001602 F9                      		stc
 13849 00001603 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 13850                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 13851                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13852                                  
 13853                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 13854                                  
 13855                                  intverify:				
 13856 00001606 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 13857 00001607 53                      		push	bx
 13858 00001608 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 13859 00001609 07                      		pop	es
 13860                                  dosimple:				
 13861 0000160A BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13862                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 13863                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 13864                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13865 0000160D 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13866                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13867 00001612 5B                      		pop	bx
 13868 00001613 07                      		pop	es
 13869 00001614 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13870                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13871                                  
 13872                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 13873                                  
 13874                                  intformat:				
 13875 00001617 06                      		push	es
 13876 00001618 53                      		push	bx
 13877 00001619 56                      		push	si
 13878 0000161A 57                      		push	di
 13879 0000161B 1E                      		push	ds
 13880                                  
 13881                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 13882                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 13883                                  
 13884 0000161C 06                      		push	es
 13885 0000161D 1E                      		push	ds
 13886 0000161E 07                      		pop	es
 13887 0000161F 1F                      		pop	ds
 13888 00001620 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 13889 00001622 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 13890 00001625 E8B9FD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 13891 00001628 1F                      		pop	ds
 13892 00001629 5F                      		pop	di
 13893 0000162A 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 13894 0000162B EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 13895                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13896                                  
 13897                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 13898                                  ; the first block.
 13899                                  ;
 13900                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 13901                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 13902                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 13903                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 13904                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 13905                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 13906                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 13907                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 13908                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 13909                                  
 13910                                  doblock:
 13911                                  
 13912                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 13913                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 13914                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 13915                                  				
 13916 0000162D 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13917                                  					; get head #, drive #
 13918 00001630 51                      		push	cx
 13919 00001631 06                      		push	es
 13920 00001632 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13921                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 13922 00001633 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 13923 00001636 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13924                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13925 0000163A 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13926                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13927 0000163F 5F                      		pop	di
 13928 00001640 07                      		pop	es
 13929 00001641 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 13930 00001643 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 13931 00001645 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 13932 00001647 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13933                                  doblockflop:				
 13934 00001649 59                      		pop	cx
 13935                                  doblockcontinue:			
 13936 0000164A 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 13937 0000164C 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 13938 0000164E 50                      		push	ax
 13939 0000164F 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 13940 00001651 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 13941                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13942                                  
 13943                                  doblocklast:				
 13944 00001653 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 13945 00001655 50                      		push	ax
 13946                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 13947 00001656 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 13948 00001659 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 13949 0000165B 58                      		pop	ax
 13950 0000165C 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 13951                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 13952 0000165F 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 13953 00001661 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 13954 00001663 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 13955 00001665 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 13956 00001667 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 13957                                  					; then we are done already.
 13958 00001669 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 13959                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 13960 0000166B E88EFD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 13961 0000166E EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 13962                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13963                                  
 13964                                  bufferx:				
 13965 00001670 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13966                                  					; set up head number
 13967                                  buffer:					
 13968 00001673 53                      		push	bx
 13969 00001674 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13970 00001677 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 13971 0000167A 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 13972                                  					
 13973                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 13974                                  
 13975 0000167C 06                      		push	es
 13976 0000167D 1E                      		push	ds
 13977 0000167E 56                      		push	si
 13978 0000167F 57                      		push	di
 13979 00001680 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 13980 00001681 06                      		push	es
 13981 00001682 1F                      		pop	ds
 13982 00001683 07                      		pop	es
 13983 00001684 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 13984 00001687 57                      		push	di		; save it
 13985 00001688 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 13986 0000168A E854FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 13987 0000168D 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 13988                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 13989 0000168E 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 13990 0000168F 5E                      		pop	si
 13991 00001690 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 13992                                  
 13993                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 13994                                  
 13995 00001691 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13996                                  					; get drive number
 13997 00001693 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 13998 00001696 E863FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 13999                                  					;
 14000                                  					; ah is	function
 14001                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14002                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14003                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14004                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14005                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14006 00001699 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14007 0000169C 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14008 0000169D 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14009 0000169F EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14010                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14011                                  
 14012                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14013                                  
 14014                                  doread:					
 14015 000016A1 06                      		push	es
 14016 000016A2 53                      		push	bx
 14017 000016A3 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14018 000016A4 07                      		pop	es
 14019 000016A5 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14020 000016A8 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14021 000016AA 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14022                                  					; get drive number
 14023 000016AD E84CFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14024                                  					; ah = function
 14025                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14026                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14027                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14028 000016B0 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14029 000016B3 5B                      		pop	bx
 14030 000016B4 07                      		pop	es
 14031 000016B5 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14032 000016B7 56                      		push	si
 14033 000016B8 57                      		push	di
 14034 000016B9 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14035 000016BB BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14036 000016BE E820FD                  		call	move_sector
 14037 000016C1 5F                      		pop	di
 14038 000016C2 5E                      		pop	si
 14039                                  
 14040                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14041                                  
 14042                                  dotail:					
 14043 000016C3 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14044 000016C4 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14045 000016C7 41                      		inc	cx
 14046 000016C8 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14047 000016CB F8                      		clc
 14048 000016CC FEC8                    		dec	al
 14049 000016CE 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14050                                  
 14051                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14052                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14053                                  
 14054 000016D0 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14055 000016D3 E826FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14056 000016D6 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14057                                  
 14058                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14059                                  
 14060                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14061                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14062                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14063                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14064                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14065                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14066                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14067                                  
 14068                                  bad13:					
 14069 000016D9 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14070 000016DB 5D                      		pop	bp
 14071 000016DC 5B                      		pop	bx
 14072 000016DD 5B                      		pop	bx
 14073 000016DE 59                      		pop	cx
 14074 000016DF 5A                      		pop	dx
 14075 000016E0 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14076 000016E2 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14077                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14078                                  
 14079                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14080 000016E5 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14081                                  
 14082                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14083                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14084                                  		;db 	0
 14085                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14086                                  
 14087                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 14088                                  
 14089                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14090                                  
 14091                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14092                                  ; MSBIO2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 14093                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14094                                  ; 17/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14095                                  
 14096                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14097                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 14098 000016E8 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 14099 000016EC BF[8706]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 14100 000016EF 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 14101 000016F0 07                      		pop	es
 14102 000016F1 E9C4EE                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 14103                                  
 14104                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14105                                  
 14106                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14107                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14108                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14109                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14110                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14111                                  
 14112                                  install_bds:		
 14113 000016F4 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14114 000016F5 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14115                                  
 14116                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14117                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14118                                  loop_next_bds:				
 14119 000016F8 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14120                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14121 000016FA 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14122 000016FE 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14123                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14124 00001701 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14125 00001703 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14126 00001705 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14127                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14128 00001709 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14129 0000170C 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14130                                  					; we don't own it
 14131 00001711 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14132                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14133 00001714 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14134 00001717 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14135                                  next_bds:				
 14136 0000171B 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14137                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14138 0000171E 75D8                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14139 00001720 8C4402                  		mov	word [si+2], es ; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14140                                  					; install bds
 14141 00001723 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14142 00001725 26C705FFFF              		mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14143                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14144 0000172A 1F                      		pop	ds
 14145                                  
 14146                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14147                                  ;
 14148                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14149                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14150                                  ;
 14151                                  ;		; 01/06/2019

 14246                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 14249                                  ; include msbio.cl2 (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
