 20927                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20928                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 20929                                  ;
 20930                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 20931                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 20932                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 20933                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 20934                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 20935                                  ; program).
 20936                                  
 20937                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 20938                                  
 20939                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 20940                                  
 20941 00001040 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 20942                                  
 20943                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 20944                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 20945                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 20946                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 20947                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 20948                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 20949                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 20950                                  ; carridge return.
 20951                                  
 20952                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 20953                                  ;character after =.
 20954

 20956 00001042 1E                      	push	ds
 20957 00001043 07                      	pop	es
 20958 00001044 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 20959 00001045 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 20960                                  
 20961 00001047 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 20962 00001049 FC                      	cld
 20963 0000104A 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 20964 00001050 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 20965                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 20966 00001053 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 20967 00001054 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 20968 00001056 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 20969 00001058 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 20970                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 20971 0000105A AC                      	lodsb
 20972 0000105B 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 20973 0000105E 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 20974 00001060 7405                    	je	short done_installparm

 20976 00001064 47                      	inc	di
 20977 00001065 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm

 21073                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21074                                  
 21075                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21076                                  ;
 21077                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21078                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21079                                  ;
 21080                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21081                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21082                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21083                                  
 21084                                  ParaRound:
 21085 000010C0 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21086 000010C3 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21087 000010C5 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21088 000010C7 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21089 000010C9 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21090 000010CB C3                      	retn
 21091                                  
 21092                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21093                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21094                                  ;
 21095                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21096                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21097                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21098                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21099                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21100                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21101                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21102                                  ;
 21103                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21104                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21105                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21106                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21107                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21108                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21109                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21110                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21111                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21112                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21113                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21114                                  ;
 21115                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21116                                  
 21117                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21118                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21119                                  sysinit_base:				
 21120 000010CC 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21121 000010D1 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21122 000010D6 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21123 000010D8 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21124 000010DD 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21125 000010E2 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21126 000010E3 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21127 000010E4 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21128                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21129                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21130 000010E6 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21131 000010E9 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21132 000010EE 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21133                                  
 21134                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21135                                  
 21136 000010F0 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21137 000010F2 0E                      	push	cs
 21138 000010F3 1F                      	pop	ds
 21139 000010F4 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21140 000010F7 CD21                    	int	21h
 21141                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21142                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21143                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21144                                  _stall: 
 21145                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21146 000010F9 F4                      	hlt 
 21147                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21148                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21149 000010FA EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21150                                  
 21151                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21152 000010FC 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21153                                  
 21154                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21155                                  
 21156                                  sum_up:
 21157                                  
 21158                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21159                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21160                                  ;
 21161                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21162                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21163                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21164                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21165                                  ;
 21166                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21167                                  
 21168 00001101 1E                      	push	ds
 21169                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21170                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21171 00001102 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21172 00001106 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21173 00001108 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21174 0000110A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21175 0000110C 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21176                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21177 00001111 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21178 00001113 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21179                                  sum1:
 21180 00001115 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21181 00001117 46                      	inc	si
 21182 00001118 46                      	inc	si
 21183 00001119 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21184                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21185                                  sum_sys_code:
 21186                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21187 0000111B BE1A11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21188                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21189                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21190                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21191                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21192                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21193                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21194                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21195 0000111E B9[B038]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit

 21228                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21229                                  ;
 21230                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21231                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21232                                  ;
 21233                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21234                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21235                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21236                                  ;
 21237                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21238                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.

 21294 0000119E 2E800E[3414]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2

 21300                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21301                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21302                                  ;
 21303                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21304                                  ;
 21305                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21306                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA

 21311 000011A7 53                      	push	bx
 21312 000011A8 52                      	push	dx
 21313 000011A9 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]

 21315                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21316 000011B2 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21317                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21318                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21319                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21320 000011B5 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21321 000011B7 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21322 000011B9 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21323                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21324 000011BC CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21325 000011BE 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21326 000011C1 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 21327 000011C3 BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21328                                  	;zf=1
 21329                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21330                                  	;zf=1
 21331 000011C6 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21332                                  got_hma:
 21333 000011CB 5A                      	pop	dx
 21334 000011CC 5B                      	pop	bx
 21335 000011CD C3                      	retn

 21365                                  ; ======================================================================
 21366                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21367                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21368                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21369                                  
 21370                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21371                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21372                                  ;
 21373                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21374                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21375                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21376                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21377                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21378                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21379                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21380                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21381                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21382                                  ;
 21383                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21384                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21385                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21386                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21387                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21388                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21389                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21390                                  ;	conditions:
 21391                                  ;
 21392                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21393                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21394                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21395                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21396                                  ;
 21397                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21398                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21399                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21400                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21401                                  ;
 21402                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21403                                  ;
 21404                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21405                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21406                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21407                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21408                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21409                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21410                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21411                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21412                                  ;
 21413                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21414                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21415                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21416                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21417                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21418                                  ;
 21419                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21420                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21421                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21422                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21423                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21424                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21425                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21426                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21427                                  ;
 21428                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21429                                  
 21430                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21431                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21432                                  
 21433                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21434                                  stackinit:
 21435 000011F6 50                      	push	ax
 21436 000011F7 1E                      	push	ds
 21437 000011F8 06                      	push	es
 21438 000011F9 53                      	push	bx
 21439 000011FA 51                      	push	cx
 21440 000011FB 52                      	push	dx
 21441 000011FC 57                      	push	di
 21442 000011FD 56                      	push	si
 21443 000011FE 55                      	push	bp
 21444                                  
 21445                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21446                                  
 21447                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21448                                  	; ds = cs
 21449 000011FF A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21450 00001202 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21451                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21452                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21453                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21454 00001204 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21455                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)

 22245 000013D4 7411                    	je	short int_xx_not_first
 22246                                  	
 22247 000013D6 81FA00F0                	cmp	dx,0F000h
 22248 000013DA 750B                    	jne	short int_xx_not_first
 22249                                  
 22250 000013DC 06                      	push	es
 22251                                  	;push	dx
 22252                                  	;mov	dx,0F000h
 22253 000013DD 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 22254 000013DF 263B1E01FF              	cmp	bx,[es:0FF01h]
 22255                                        	;pop	dx
 22256 000013E4 07                      	pop	es
 22257 000013E5 7401                    	je	short int_xx_first
 22258                                  
 22259                                  int_xx_not_first:
 22260 000013E7 F9                      	stc
 22261                                  int_xx_first:
 22262 000013E8 1F                      	pop	ds
 22263 000013E9 C3                      	retn
 22264                                  
 22265                                  ;%endif
 22266                                  
 22267                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22268                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22269                                  
 22270                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22271                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22272                                  
 22273                                  new_init_loop:
 22274                                  
 22275                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22276                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22277                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22278                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22279                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22280                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22281                                  
 22282 000013EA 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22283 000013ED 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22284 000013EF 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22285 000013F3 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22286                                  
 22287 000013F6 1E                      	push	ds
 22288                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22289                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22290                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22291 000013F7 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22292 000013FA 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22293 000013FC 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22294 000013FF 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22295 00001401 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22296 00001405 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22297 00001408 1F                      	pop	ds
 22298                                  
 22299 00001409 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22300 0000140C 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22301 00001410 C3                      	retn
 22302                                  
 22303                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22304                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22305                                  
 22306                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22307                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22308                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22309                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22310                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22311                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22312                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22313                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22314                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22315                                  
 22316                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22317                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22318                                  
 22319                                  setdevmark:
 22320                                  
 22321 00001411 06                      	push	es
 22322 00001412 51                      	push	cx
 22323                                  
 22324 00001413 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22325 00001418 2E890E[3214]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22326 0000141D 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22327                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22328                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22329 0000141F 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22330 00001423 41                      	inc	cx
 22331                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22332 00001424 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22333                                  
 22334 00001429 59                      	pop	cx
 22335 0000142A 07                      	pop	es
 22336 0000142B 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22337 00001430 C3                      	retn
 22338

 22518                                  ;-------------

 22539                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 22540                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22541                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22542                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 22543                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 22544                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 22545                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22546                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 22547                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22548

 22550                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 22551 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 22552 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 22553 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 22554                                  endstruc

 22558                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 22559                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 22560

 22575                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22576 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22577 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22578 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22579                                  endstruc
 22580                                  
 22581                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22582                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22583                                  ;
 22584                                  ;
 22585                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22586                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22587                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22588                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22589                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22590                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22591                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22592                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22593                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22594                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22595                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22596                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22597                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22598                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22599                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22600                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22601                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22602                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22603                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22604                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22605                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22606                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22607                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22608                                  ;	   :
 22609                                  ;
 22610                                  ;Note:
 22611                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22612                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22613                                  ;
 22614                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22615                                  ;
 22616                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22617                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22618                                  ;
 22619                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22620                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22621                                  ;
 22622                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22623                                  ;
 22624                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22625                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22626                                  ;
 22627                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22628                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22629                                  ;
 22630                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22631                                  ;
 22632                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22633                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22634                                  ;
 22635                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22636                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22637                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22638                                  ;
 22639                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22640                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22641                                  ;
 22642                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22643                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22644                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22645                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22646                                  
 22647                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22648                                  
 22649                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22650                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22651                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22652                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22653                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22654                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22655                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22656                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22657                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22658                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22659                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22660                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22661                                  
 22662                                  ;**** Function flags
 22663                                  
 22664                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22665                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22666                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22667                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22668                                  
 22669                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22670                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22671 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22672 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22673 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22674 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22675 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22676 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22677                                  endstruc
 22678                                  
 22679                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22680                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22681                                  ;
 22682                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22683                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22684                                  ;	     +-
 22685                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22686                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22687                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22688                                  ;	     |	:
 22689                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22690                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22691                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22692                                  ;	     |	:
 22693                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22694                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22695                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22696                                  ;	     +-	:
 22697                                  ;
 22698                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22699                                  ;
 22700                                  ;Note:
 22701                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22702                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22703                                  ;
 22704                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22705                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22706                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22707                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22708                                  
 22709                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22710                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22711                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22712                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22713                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 22714                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 22715                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 22716                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 22717                                  
 22718                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 22719 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 22720 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 22721 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 22722 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 22723 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 22724                                  endstruc
 22725                                  
 22726                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22727                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 22728                                  ;
 22729                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 22730                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 22731                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 22732                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 22733                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 22734                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 22735                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 22736                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 22737                                  ;
 22738                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 22739                                  ;
 22740                                  ;            +-
 22741                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 22742                                  ;	    | or
 22743                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 22744                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 22745                                  ;	    | or
 22746                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 22747                                  ;	    | or
 22748                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 22749                                  ;	    | or
 22750                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 22751                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 22752                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 22753                                  ;	    | or
 22754                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 22755                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 22756                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 22757                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 22758                                  ;	    +-
 22759                                  ;
 22760                                  ;
 22761                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 22762                                  ;      list.
 22763                                  ;
 22764                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 22765                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 22766                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 22767                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22768                                  
 22769                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 22770                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 22771 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 22772 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 22773 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 22774 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 22775                                  endstruc
 22776

 22801                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 22802                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 22803                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 22804                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 22805                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 22806                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 22890                                  ;***********************************************************************
 22891                                  ; SysParse;
 22892                                  ;
 22893                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 22894                                  ;
 22895                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 22896                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 22897                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 22898                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 22899                                  ;
 22900                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 22901                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 22902                                  ;		 is in DS.
 22903                                  ;
 22904                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 22905                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 22906                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 22907                                  ;
 22908                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 22909                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 22910                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 22911                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 22912                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 22913                                  ;
 22914                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 22915                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 22916                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 22917                                  ;
 22918                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 22919                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 22920                                  ;
 22921                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 22922                                  ;
 22923                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 22924                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 22925                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 22926                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 22927                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 22928                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 22929                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 22930                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 22931                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 22932                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 22933                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 22934                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 22935                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 22936                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 22937                                  ;	     (tm08)
 22938                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 22939                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 22940                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 22941                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 22942                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 22943                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 22944                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 22945                                  ;					  (tm12)
 22946                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 22947                                  ;					  (tm13)
 22948                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 22949                                  ;					  (tm14)
 22950                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 22951                                  ;					  (tm15)
 22952                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 22953                                  
 22954                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 22955                                  
 22956                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 22957                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 22958                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 22959                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 22960                                  
 22961                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 22962                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 22963                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 22964                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 22965                                  ;
 22966                                  
 22967                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 22968                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 22969                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 22970                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 22971                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 22972                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 22973                                  
 22974                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 22975                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 22976                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 22977                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 22978                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 22979                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 22980                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 22981                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 22982                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 22983                                  
 22984                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 22985                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 22986                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 22987                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 22988                                  ;	     segment.
 22989                                  
 22990                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 22991                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 22992                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 22993                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 22994                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 22995                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 22996                                  
 22997                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 22998                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 22999                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments

 23011                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.

 23095                                  ; The table of special chars _$P_FileSp_Char should be initialized on every
 23096                                  ;entry to SysParse. This is in the non-checksum region and any program that

 23098                                  ;command.com parsing in an inconsistent state.
 23099                                  ; NB: The special characters string has been hardcoded here. If any change
 23100                                  ;is made to it in psdata.inc, a corresponding change needs to be made here.

 23106 00001516 2EC706[DB14]3B3D        	mov 	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+6], ';='

 23525                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23526                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23527                                  ;
 23528                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23529                                  ;
 23530                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23531                                  ;	    AL = type
 23532                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23533                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23534                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23535                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23536                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23537                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 23538                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 23539                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23540                                  ;
 23541                                  ; Output:   None
 23542                                  ;
 23543                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23544                                  ;
 23545                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 23546                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23547                                  
 23548                                  _$P_Fill_Result:

 23760                                  ; _$P_Remove_Colon;
 23761                                  ;
 23762                                  ; Function: Remove colon at end
 23763                                  ;
 23764                                  ; Input:    cs:SI points to string buffer to be examineed
 23765                                  ;
 23766                                  ; Output:   None
 23767                                  ;
 23768                                  ; Use:	_$P_Chk_DBCS

 23770                                  
 23771                                  _$P_Remove_Colon:
 23772 00001846 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23773 00001847 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 23774                                  _$P_RCOL_Loop:				;AN000;
 23775 00001848 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 23776 0000184B 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 23777 0000184D 741A                    	jz	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; if yes, just exit
 23778                                  
 23779 0000184F 3C3A                    	cmp	al,_$P_Colon		;AN000; is it colon ?
 23780 00001851 750D                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000;
 23781                                  
 23782 00001853 2E807C0100              	cmp	byte [cs:si+1],_$P_NULL ;AN000; if so, next is NULL ?
 23783 00001858 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000; no, then next char
 23784                                  
 23785 0000185A 2EC60400                	mov	byte [cs:si],_$P_NULL	;AN000; yes, remove colon
 23786 0000185E EB09                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; and exit.
 23787                                  
 23788                                  _$P_RCOL00:				;AN000;
 23789 00001860 E81904                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; if not colon, then check if
 23790 00001863 7301                    	jnc	short _$P_RCOL01	;AN000; DBCS leading byte.
 23791                                  
 23792 00001865 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; if yes, skip trailing byte
 23793                                  _$P_RCOL01:				;AN000;
 23794 00001866 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si points to next byte
 23795 00001867 EBDF                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 23796                                  
 23797                                  _$P_RCOL_Exit:				;AN000;
 23798 00001869 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 23799 0000186A 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23800 0000186B C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 23802                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23803                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_String;
 23804                                  ;
 23805                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 23806                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 23807                                  ;
 23808                                  ; Input:    AL = 2 : Use character table
 23809                                  ;	    AL = 4 : Use file table
 23810                                  ;	    cs:SI points to string buffer to be capitalized
 23811                                  ;
 23812                                  ; Output:   None
 23813                                  ;
 23814                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23815                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23816                                  
 23817                                  _$P_Do_CAPS_String:
 23818 0000186C 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 23819 0000186D 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 23820 0000186E 88C2                    	mov	dl,al			;AN000; save info id
 23821                                  
 23822                                  _$P_DCS_Loop:				;AN000;
 23823 00001870 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; load charater and
 23824 00001873 E80604                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; check if DBCS leading byte
 23825 00001876 720C                    	jc	short _$P_DCS00		;AN000; if yes, do not need CAPS
 23826                                  
 23827 00001878 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 23828 0000187A 740C                    	jz	short _$P_DCS_Exit	;AN000; then exit.
 23829                                  
 23830 0000187C E80C00                  	call	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char 	;AN000; Here a SBCS char need to be CAPS
 23831 0000187F 2E8804                  	mov	[cs:si],al		;AN000; stored upper case char to buffer
 23832 00001882 EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS01		;AN000; process next
 23833                                  _$P_DCS00:				;AN000;

 23936                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue

 23941                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling

 24179                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24180                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 24181                                  ;
 24182                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 24183                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 24184                                  ;
 24185                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 24186                                  ;
 24187                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 24188                                  ;
 24189                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 24190                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24191                                  
 24192                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24193                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 24194 000019D4 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 24195 000019D5 2EF606[4714]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 24196 000019DB 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 24197                                  
 24198 000019DD 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 24199 000019DE C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24200                                  
 24201                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24202 000019DF 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24203 000019E0 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24204                                  
 24205 000019E2 F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 24206 000019E3 C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 24207                                  
 24208                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 24209                                  _$P_0099Err: ; 14/08/2023
 24210 000019E4 F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 24211                                  _$P_0099Err2: ; 14/08/2023
 24212 000019E5 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24213                                  
 24214                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24215                                  ; _$P_0099;
 24216                                  ;
 24217                                  ; Function:  Make ASCII 0-9 to Binary 0-9
 24218                                  ;
 24219                                  ; Input:     AL = character code
 24220                                  ;
 24221                                  ; Output:    CY = 1 : AL is not number
 24222                                  ;	     CY = 0 : AL contains binary value
 24223                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24224

 24914                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24915                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 24916                                  ;
 24917                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 24918                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 24919                                  ;
 24920                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24921                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 24922                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 24923                                  ;
 24924                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 24925                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 24926                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 24927                                  
 24928                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 24929                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 24930                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 24931                                  ;
 24932                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 24933                                  
 24934                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 24935                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24936                                  
 24937                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 24938                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 24939                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 24940                                  	; 14/08/2023
 24941 00001C63 BD[5014]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 24942                                  
 24943                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 24944 00001C66 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 24945 00001C68 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 24946                                  
 24947                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 24948 00001C6A 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24949 00001C6C 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 24950                                  
 24951 00001C6E F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 24952                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24953                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24954 00001C6F C3                      	retn
 24955                                  
 24956                                  ; 12/12/2022
 24957                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 24958                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 24959                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24960                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 24961                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24962                                  
 24963                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 24964                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 24965 00001C70 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24966 00001C72 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 24967                                  
 24968 00001C74 2E800E[4714]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 24969                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24970                                  
 24971                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24972                                  	; cf=0
 24973                                  	;retn
 24974                                  
 24975                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 24976                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24977                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 24978 00001C7A F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 24979                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 24980                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 24981 00001C7B C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 24983                                  ;**************************************************************************
 24984                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24985                                  ;
 24986                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 24987                                  ;
 24988                                  ;  Input:
 24989                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 24990                                  ;
 24991                                  ;  Output:
 24992                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 24993                                  ;
 24994                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 24995                                  ;
 24996                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 24997                                  ;***************************************************************************
 24998                                  
 24999                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25000 00001C7C 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 25001 00001C7D 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25002 00001C7E 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)

 25007 00001C84 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 25008 00001C86 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 25009 00001C88 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25010 00001C89 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25011 00001C8A 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25012 00001C8B 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25013 00001C8C 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25014 00001C8D 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 25015 00001C8E 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25016                                  	; si = 0 ; 14/08/2023
 25017                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;

 25019 00001C91 B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 25020 00001C94 CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 25021                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 25022 00001C96 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25023 00001C98 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25024 00001C9A 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 25025 00001C9B 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25026 00001C9C 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25027 00001C9D 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25028 00001C9E 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25029 00001C9F 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25030 00001CA0 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25031 00001CA1 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25032                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25033 00001CA3 2E8936[4214]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25034 00001CA8 2E891E[4414]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25035                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25036                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset

 25040                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25041 00001CB2 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?

 25045 00001CBB 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of

 25051 00001CC4 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25052                                  					;AN000; get next vector

 25074                                  struc p_parms
 25075 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?
 25076 00000002 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; an extra delimiter list
 25077 00000003 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; length is 1
 25078 00000004 ??                      	resb 	1	; db ';' ; delimiter
 25079                                  .size:
 25080                                  endstruc
 25081                                  
 25082                                  struc p_pos
 25083 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; numeric value??
 25084 00000002 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; function
 25085 00000004 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; result value buffer
 25086                                  
 25087                                  ; note: by defining result_val before this structure, we could remove
 25088                                  ;  the "result_val" from every structure invocation
 25089                                  
 25090 00000006 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; value list
 25091 00000008 ??                      	resb	1	; db 0	; no switches/keywords
 25092                                  .size:
 25093                                  endstruc
 25094                                  
 25095                                  struc	p_range
 25096 00000000 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; range definition
 25097 00000001 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; 1 definition of range
 25098 00000002 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; item tag for this range
 25099 00000003 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric min
 25100 00000007 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric max
 25101                                  .size:
 25102                                  endstruc
