 25616                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 25617                                  
 25618                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25619                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25620                                  
 25621                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25622                                  ;
 25623                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25624                                  ;
 25625                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25626                                  ;
 25627                                  ;   Modification log:
 25628                                  ;
 25629                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25630                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25631                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25632                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25633                                  ;
 25634                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25635                                  ;
 25636                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25637                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25638                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25639                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25640                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25641                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25642                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25643                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25644                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25645                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25646                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25647                                  ;
 25648                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25649                                  
 25650                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25651                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25652                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25653                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25654                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25655                                  
 25656                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25657                                  
 25658                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25659                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25660                                  
 25661                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25662                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25663                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25664                                  
 25665                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25666                                  ;
 25667                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25668                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25669                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25670                                  ;	           line.
 25671                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25672                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25673                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25674                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25675                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25676                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25677                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25678                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25679                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25680                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25681                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25682                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25683                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25684                                  ;	           for details).
 25685                                  
 25686                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 25687                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 25688                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 25689                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 25690                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25691                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25692                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 25693                                  fm_strat: db	0
 25694                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 25695                                  
 25696                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25697                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25698                                  
 25699                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25700                                  
 25701                                  %endif
 25702

 25750                                  
 25751                                  ; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 25753                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25754                                  ; (SYSINIT:215Eh)
 25755                                  
 25756                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25757                                  ;
 25758                                  ; procedure : doconf
 25759                                  ;
 25760                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 25761                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 25762                                  ;
 25763                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25764                                  
 25765                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25766                                  doconf:
 25767 00001EE1 0E                      	push	cs
 25768 00001EE2 1F                      	pop	ds
 25769                                  
 25770 00001EE3 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 25771                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 25772 00001EE6 CD21                    	int	21h
 25773 00001EE8 8816[AA02]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 25774                                  
 25775                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25776                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25777                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 25778                                  ;	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 25779                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25780                                  
 25781 00001EEC BA[C433]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 25782 00001EEF B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 25783                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 25784 00001EF2 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25785 00001EF3 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25786 00001EF5 7306                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 25787                                  
 25788                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25789                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25790                                  ;      	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 25791                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 25792                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 25793 00001EF7 C606[4903]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 25794 00001EFC C3                      	retn
 25795                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 25796 00001EFD 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 25797 00001EFF 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 25798 00001F01 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25799                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 25800 00001F03 B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 25801 00001F06 CD21                    	int	21h
 25802 00001F08 A3[D203]                	mov	[count],ax
 25803                                  
 25804 00001F0B 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25805                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 25806 00001F0D B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 25807 00001F10 CD21                    	int	21h
 25808                                  
 25809                                  	;mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 25810                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25811 00001F12 8B16[A102]              	mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 25812                                  
 25813 00001F16 A1[D203]                	mov	ax,[count]
 25814 00001F19 A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 25815 00001F1C E8A1F1                  	call	ParaRound
 25816 00001F1F 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 25817                                  
 25818                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25819                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25820                                  ;;
 25821                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 25822                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 25823                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 25824                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 25825                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 25826                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 25827                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 25828                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 25829                                  ;;
 25830                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 25831                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 25832                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 25833                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25834                                  
 25835 00001F21 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 25836                                  	
 25837                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 25838                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 25839                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25840 00001F24 8916[A102]              	mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 25841 00001F28 E8ABEC                  	call    TempCDS 
 25842                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25843                                  	; ds <> cs 
 25844 00001F2B 2E8B16[A102]            	mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 25845                                   
 25846 00001F30 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 25847 00001F32 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 25848                                  
 25849 00001F34 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25850 00001F36 2E8B0E[D203]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 25851 00001F3B B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 25852                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 25853 00001F3D F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25854 00001F3E CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25855 00001F40 9C                      	pushf
 25856                                  
 25857                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 25858                                  
 25859 00001F41 50                      	push	ax
 25860 00001F42 57                      	push	di
 25861 00001F43 51                      	push	cx
 25862 00001F44 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 25863 00001F46 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 25864 00001F48 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 25865 00001F4A F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 25866 00001F4C 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 25867                                  
 25868                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 25869                                  
 25870 00001F4E 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 25871                                  
 25872                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 25873                                  
 25874                                  puteol:
 25875 00001F4F B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 25876 00001F51 AA                      	stosb
 25877 00001F52 B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 25878 00001F54 AA                      	stosb
 25879 00001F55 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 25880                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25881                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 25882                                  
 25883                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 25884                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25885 00001F57 0E                      	push	cs
 25886 00001F58 1F                      	pop	ds
 25887                                  
 25888 00001F59 893E[D203]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 25889                                  
 25890 00001F5D 59                      	pop	cx
 25891 00001F5E 5F                      	pop	di
 25892 00001F5F 58                      	pop	ax
 25893                                  
 25894                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25895                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25896                                  	;push	cs
 25897                                  	;pop	ds
 25898                                  
 25899 00001F60 50                      	push	ax
 25900                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 25901 00001F61 B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 25902 00001F63 CD21                    	int	21h
 25903 00001F65 58                      	pop	ax
 25904 00001F66 9D                      	popf
 25905 00001F67 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 25906 00001F69 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 25907 00001F6B 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 25908                                  conferr:
 25909 00001F6D BA[C433]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 25910 00001F70 E8A813                  	call	badfil
 25911                                  endconv:
 25912 00001F73 C3                      	retn
 25913                                  
 25914                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25915                                  ;
 25916                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 25917                                  ;
 25918                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
 25919                                  ;
 25920                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25921                                  
 25922                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25923                                  multi_pass:
 25924 00001F74 0E                      	push	cs
 25925 00001F75 1F                      	pop	ds
 25926                                  
 25927 00001F76 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 25928                                  ;jae_endconv:
 25929 00001F7B 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 25930                                  
 25931                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 25932                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25933 00001F7D FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 25934 00001F81 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 25935                                  
 25936 00001F82 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 25937 00001F86 8936[D203]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 25938 00001F8A 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0

 25959                                  %if 0

 25961                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG

 25964                                  ;   number immediately following it....

 25966                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code

 25968                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh

 25970                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 25971                                  
 25972                                          push    ax                      ;
 25973                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 25974                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 25975                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 25976                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 25977                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 25978                                          pop     ax
 25979                                  ;
 25980                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 25981                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 25982                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 25983                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 25984                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 25985                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 25986                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 25987                                  ;   spot.
 25988                                  ;
 25989                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 25990                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 25991                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 25992                                  ;   retrieved.
 25993                                  ;
 25994                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 25995                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25996                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 25997                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25998                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 25999                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 26000                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26001                                  final:                                  ;
 26002                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 26003                                  not_final:                              ;
 26004                                  ;endif
 26005                                  
 26006                                  %endif

 26174                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26175                                  ;									      *
 26176                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26177                                  ;									      *
 26178                                  ; input :								      *
 26179                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26180                                  ; output:								      *
 26181                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26182                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26183                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 26184                                  ;									      *
 26185                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26186                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26187                                  ; logic:								      *
 26188                                  ; {									      *
 26189                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 26190                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26191                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 26192                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26193                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26194                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26195                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 26196                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 26197                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 26198                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 26199                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 26200                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 26201                                  ;	};								      *
 26202                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 26203                                  ; };									      *
 26204                                  ;									      *
 26205                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26206                                  
 26207                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26208                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 26209                                  tryb:
 26210 0000201A 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 26211 0000201D 7557                    	jne	short tryc
 26212                                  
 26213                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26214                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26215                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26216                                  ;       jc      short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26217                                  ;;endif
 26218                                  
 26219                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26220                                  	; 18/12/2022

 26222                                  	;mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; 31/03/2019
 26223 00002021 880E[121D]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0
 26224

 26226                                  	;xor	cx,cx	; 18/12/2022
 26227                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26228                                  	;mov	dx,cx

 26230 00002028 E87D06                  	call	sysinit_parse
 26231 0000202B 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 26232                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26233                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 26234                                  	;;jmp	short sr7
 26235                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26236                                  ;sr7:
 26237                                  	;jmp	coff
 26238                                  	; 04/01/2023

 26243                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x

 26293                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26294                                  ; break command
 26295                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26296                                  
 26297                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26298                                  ;									    *
 26299                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 26300                                  ;									    *
 26301                                  ; input :								    *
 26302                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 26303                                  ; output:								    *
 26304                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 26305                                  ;									    *
 26306                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 26307                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 26308                                  ; logic:								    *
 26309                                  ; {									    *
 26310                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 26311                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 26312                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 26313                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 26314                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 26315                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 26316                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 26317                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 26318                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 26319                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 26320                                  ;	};								    *
 26321                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 26322                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 26323                                  ; };									    *
 26324                                  ;									    *
 26325                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26326                                  
 26327                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26328                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)
 26329                                  tryc:
 26330 00002076 80FC43                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BREAK ; 'C'
 26331 00002079 7534                    	jne	short trym
 26332                                  
 26333                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26334                                  ;;ifdef MULTI_CONFIG
 26335                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26336                                  ;       jc	short trym		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26337                                  ;;endif
 26338 0000207B BF[1C1D]                	mov	di,brk_parms
 26339 0000207E 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26340                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26341                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 26342                                  do22:
 26343 00002080 E82506                  	call	sysinit_parse
 26344 00002083 7303                    	jnc	short if22		; parse error
 26345                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  show message and end the search loop.
 26346                                  	;;jmp	short sr22
 26347                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26348                                  ;sr22:
 26349                                  	;jmp	coff
 26350                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26351 00002085 E99E05                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 26352                                  if22:
 26353 00002088 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL		; end of line?
 26354 0000208B 7415                    	je	short en22		; then end the $endloop
 26355                                  
 26356                                  	;cmp	byte [result_val_itag],1
 26357 0000208D 803E[151D]01            	cmp	byte [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],1
 26358 00002092 7507                    	jne	short if26
 26359                                  
 26360 00002094 C606[411D]01            	mov	byte [p_ctrl_break],1	; turn it on
 26361                                  	;jmp	short en26
 26362                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26363 00002099 EBE5                    	jmp	short do22
 26364                                  if26:

 26366                                  en26:

 26368                                  en22:
 26369 000020A2 B433                    	mov	ah,SET_CTRL_C_TRAPPING ; if we don't have any parse error.
 26370 000020A4 B001                    	mov	al,1

 26379                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26380                                  ; multitrack command
 26381                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26382                                  
 26383                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26384                                  ;									      *
 26385                                  ; function: parse the parameters of multitrack= command.		      *
 26386                                  ;									      *
 26387                                  ; input :								      *
 26388                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26389                                  ; output:								      *
 26390                                  ;	turn multrk_flag on or off.					      *
 26391                                  ;									      *
 26392                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26393                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26394                                  ; logic:								      *
 26395                                  ; {									      *
 26396                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						      *
 26397                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26398                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26399                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26400                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26401                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */   *
 26402                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,on;					      *
 26403                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */   *
 26404                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,off;					      *
 26405                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				      *
 26406                                  ;	};								      *
 26407                                  ;	if (no error) then						      *
 26408                                  ;	   dos function call to set multrk_flag according to p_mtrk.	      *
 26409                                  ;									      *
 26410                                  ; };									      *
 26411                                  ;									      *

 26856                                  ;	Note: sysi_numio (in DOS DATA) currently reflects the REAL
 26857                                  ;	number of installed devices (including DblSpace drives) where
 26858                                  ;	"drivenumber" is the number that the next block device will
 26859                                  ;	be assigned to. Because some naughty device drivers (like
 26860                                  ;	interlnk) look at the internal DOS variable instead of the
 26861                                  ;	value we pass it, we'll temporarily stick our value into
 26862                                  ;	DOS DATA while we're initializing the device drivers.
 26863                                  ;
 26864                                  ;	Note that this will make it impossible for this device
 26865                                  ;	driver to access the DblSpace drive letters, whether
 26866                                  ;	they are swapped-hosts or unswapped compressed drives,

 27720                                  
 27721                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27722                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 27723                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 27724                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 27725                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 27726                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 27727                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 27728                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 27729                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27730                                  
 27731                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27732                                  ;									  *
 27733                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 27734                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 27735                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 27736                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 27737                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 27738                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 27739                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 27740                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 27741                                  ; input :								  *
 27742                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 27743                                  ; output:								  *
 27744                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 27745                                  ;									  *
 27746                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 27747                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 27748                                  ; logic:								  *
 27749                                  ; {									  *
 27750                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 27751                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 27752                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 27753                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 27754                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 27755                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 27756                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27757                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 27758                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27759                                  ;	     }								  *
 27760                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 27761                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 27762                                  ;	};								  *
 27763                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 27764                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 27765                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 27766                                  ; };									  *
 27767                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27768                                  
 27769                                  tryk:

 28437                                  
 28438                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28439                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 28440                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 28441                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 28442                                  ;
 28443                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 28444                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 28445                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 28446                                  ;	*** after each call.
 28447                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 28448                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 28449                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 28450                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 28451                                  ;	 procedure.
 28452                                  ;	ax - exit code
 28453                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 28454                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 28455                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 28456                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 28457                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 28459                                  	; 24/10/2022

 28673                                  ; and display showcount at the current curser position.
 28674                                  ; in.) linecount
 28675                                  ;

 28697 00002723 B90A00                  	mov	cx,10		; decimal divide factor
 28698                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:linecount]

 28700 00002726 A1[2B03]                	mov	ax,[linecount]
 28701                                  sln_loop:
 28702                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28703 00002729 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; < 10 ?
 28704                                  	;cmp	ax,10		; < 10?
 28705 0000272B 720C                    	jb	short sln_last
 28706

 28708 0000272F F7F1                    	div	cx	; cx = 10
 28709 00002731 80CA30                  	or	dl,30h		; add "0" (= 30h) to make it an ascii.
 28710 00002734 8815                    	mov	[di],dl
 28711 00002736 4F                      	dec	di
 28712 00002737 EBF0                    	jmp	short sln_loop
 28713

 28781                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28782                                  ;
 28783                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 28784                                  ;
 28785                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 28786                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 28787                                  ;
 28788                                  ;	Output : none
 28789                                  ;
 28790                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 28791                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 28792                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28793                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 28794                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28795                                  ;
 28796                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28797                                  
 28798                                  LieInt12Mem:
 28799                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28800                                  	; ds = cs
 28801 00002768 A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 28802                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 28803                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 28804 0000276B E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 28805 0000276E 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 28806                                  	; 13/05/2019
 28807                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 28808                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 28809                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 28810                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28811                                  	; ds = cs
 28812 00002770 803E[CB1E]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 28813 00002775 74F0                    	je	short limx
 28814 00002777 A1[B21E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 28815                                  lim_set:
 28816                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28817                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28818                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 28819                                  ;limx:
 28820                                  	;retn
 28821                                  	
 28822                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 28823                                  
 28824                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28825                                  ;
 28826                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 28827                                  ;
 28828                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 28829                                  ;	Output : none
 28830                                  ;
 28831                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 28832                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 28833                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 28834                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 28835                                  ;
 28836                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28837                                  
 28838                                  	; 01/11/2022
 28839                                  SetInt12Mem:
 28840 0000277A 1E                      	push	ds
 28841 0000277B BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 28842 0000277E 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 28843 00002780 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 28844 00002784 2E891E[CF1E]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 28845 00002789 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 28846 0000278B D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 28847 0000278D A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 28848 00002790 2EC606[CE1E]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 28849 00002796 1F                      	pop	ds
 28850                                  ;limx:
 28851 00002797 C3                      	retn
 28852                                  
 28853                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28854                                  ;
 28855                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 28856                                  ;
 28857                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 28858                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 28859                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 28860                                  ;
 28861                                  ;	Output : none
 28862                                  ;
 28863                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 28864                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 28865                                  ;
 28866                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28867                                  
 28868                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 28869                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28870                                  	; ds = cs
 28871 00002798 803E[CE1E]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28872                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 28873                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 28874                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 28875 0000279D 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 28876                                  	; 18/12/2022
 28877 0000279F B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 28878 000027A2 8826[CE1E]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 28879                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28880                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 28881 000027A6 1E                      	push	ds
 28882                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 28883 000027A7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 28884 000027A9 2EA1[CF1E]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 28885 000027AD A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 28886 000027B0 1F                      	pop	ds
 28887                                  timx:
 28888 000027B1 C3                      	retn
 28889                                  
 28890                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28891                                  ;
 28892                                  ; procedure : IsIt3Com?
 28893                                  ;
 28894                                  ;	Input : DevEntry = Seg:0 of device driver
 28895                                  ;	Output : Zero flag set if device name is 'PROTMAN$'
 28896                                  ;		 else Zero flag is reset
 28897                                  ;
 28898                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28899                                  
 28900                                  IsIt3Com:
 28901                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28902                                  	; ds = cs
 28903 000027B2 1E                      	push	ds
 28904 000027B3 06                      	push	es
 28905 000027B4 56                      	push	si
 28906                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28907 000027B5 C536[B41E]              	lds	si,[DevEntry]
 28908                                  	;lds	si,[cs:DevEntry]	; ptr to device header
 28909 000027B9 83C60A                  	add	si,SYSDEV.NAME ; 10 	; ptr device name
 28910 000027BC 0E                      	push	cs
 28911 000027BD 07                      	pop	es
 28912 000027BE BF[D11E]                	mov	di,ThreeComName
 28913 000027C1 B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; name length
 28914 000027C4 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 28915 000027C6 5E                      	pop	si
 28916 000027C7 07                      	pop	es

 28918 000027C9 C3                      	retn

 28941                                  
 28942                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 28943                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 28944                                  
 28945                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28946                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 28947                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28948                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28949                                  
 28950                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28951                                  ;
 28952                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 28953                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 28954                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 28955                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 28956                                  ;
 28957                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 28958                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 28959                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 28960                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 28961                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 28962                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 28963                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 28964                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 28965                                  ; available during the load.
 28966                                  ;
 28967                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 28968                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 28969                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 28970                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 28971                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 28972                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 28973                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 28974                                  ;
 28975                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 28976                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 28977                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 28978                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 28979                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 28980                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 28981                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 28982                                  ;
 28983                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28984                                  
 28985                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 28986                                  
 28987                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 28988                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 28989                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 28990                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 28991                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 28992                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 28993                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 28994                                  
 28995                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 28996                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 28997                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 28998                                  
 28999                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29000                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 29001                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29002                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 29003                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 29004                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 29005                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29006                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29007                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 29008                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 29009                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29010                                  
 29011                                  InitVar:
 29012                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 29013                                  	push	ax
 29014                                  	push	cx
 29015                                  	push	di
 29016                                  	push	es
 29017                                  
 29018                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 29019                                  	push	cs
 29020                                  	pop	es
 29021                                  
 29022                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29023                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 29024                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 29025                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 29026                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 29027                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 29028                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 29029                                  
 29030                                  	cld
 29031                                  
 29032                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 29033                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 29034                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 29035                                  
 29036                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 29037                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 29038                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 29039                                  
 29040                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 29041                                  
 29042                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 29043                                  	pop	es
 29044                                  	pop	di
 29045                                  	pop	cx
 29046                                  	pop	ax	 	
 29047                                  
 29048                                  	retn
 29049                                  
 29050                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29051                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 29052                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29053                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 29054                                  ; EXIT    : None
 29055                                  ; ERROR   : None
 29056                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 29057                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29058                                  
 29059                                  FixMem:
 29060                                  	push	ax
 29061                                  	push	bx
 29062                                  	push	cx
 29063                                  	push	dx
 29064                                  	push	es
 29065                                  
 29066                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 29067                                  
 29068                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 29069                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 29070                                  
 29071                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 29072                                  
 29073                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 29074                                  
 29075                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 29076                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 29077                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 29078                                  
 29079                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29080                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 29081                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 29082                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29083                                  
 29084                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 29085                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 29086                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 29087                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 29088                                  
 29089                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 29090                                  
 29091                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 29092                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 29093                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 29094                                  
 29095                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 29096                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 29097                                  	; 14/08/2023
 29098                                  	inc	bx
 29099                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 29100                                  
 29101                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 29102                                  
 29103                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 29104                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 29105                                  
 29106                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 29107                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29108                                  	inc	bx
 29109                                  	mov	es,bx
 29110                                  
 29111                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 29112                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 29113                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 29114                                  fmX:	
 29115                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 29116                                  
 29117                                  	pop	es
 29118                                  	pop	dx
 29119                                  	pop	cx
 29120                                  	pop	bx
 29121                                  	pop	ax
 29122                                  
 29123                                  	retn
 29124                                  
 29125                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29126                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 29127                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29128                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29129                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 29130                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29131                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 29132                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29133                                  
 29134                                  fm_link:
 29135                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 29136                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 29137                                  
 29138                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 29139                                  	;
 29140                                  	;push	es
 29141                                  	;push	cs
 29142                                  	;pop	es
 29143                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 29144                                  	;pop	es
 29145                                  	
 29146                                  	mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 29147                                  
 29148                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29149                                  	mov	bx,1
 29150                                  	int	21h
 29151                                  	retn
 29152                                  
 29153                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29154                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 29155                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29156                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 29157                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29158                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29159                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 29160                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29161                                  
 29162                                  fm_unlink:
 29163                                  	xor	bx,bx
 29164                                  	
 29165                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 29166                                  	;
 29167                                  	;push	ds
 29168                                  	;push	cs
 29169                                  	;pop	ds
 29170                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 29171                                  	;pop	ds
 29172                                  	
 29173                                  	mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 29174                                  
 29175                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29176                                  	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 29177                                  	retn
 29178                                  
 29179                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29180                                  
 29181                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29182                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 29183                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 29184                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29185                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 29186                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 29187                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 29188                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29189                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29190                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 29191                                  ;
 29192                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 29193                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 29194                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29195                                  ;
 29196                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 29197                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 29198                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 29199                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 29200                                  ;
 29201                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 29202                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 29203                                  ;
 29204                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29205                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 29206                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 29207                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 29208                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 29209                                  ;     lh
 29210                                  ;     /l
 29211                                  ;     1
 29212                                  ;     1000
 29213                                  ;     2
 29214                                  ;     print
 29215                                  ;     /d
 29216                                  ;     :lpt2
 29217                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 29218                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 29219                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 29220                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 29221                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 29222                                  ; for:
 29223                                  ;    Each /L
 29224                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 29225                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 29226                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 29227                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 29228                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 29229                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29230                                  
 29231                                  ParseVar:
 29232                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 29233                                  	push	di
 29234                                  	push	ds
 29235                                  	push	es
 29236                                  
 29237                                  	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 29238                                  	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 29239                                  	cld
 29240                                  
 29241                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29242                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 29243                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29244                                  
 29245                                  pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 29246                                  	call	isWhite
 29247                                  	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 29248                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29249                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH
 29250                                  	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 29251                                  
 29252                                  	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 29253                                  	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 29254                                  	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 29255                                  
 29256                                  pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 29257                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 29258                                  	and	al,0DFh
 29259                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 29260                                  	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 29261                                  	jne	short pv30
 29262                                  
 29263                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29264                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29265                                  
 29266                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 29267                                  	;
 29268                                  	;push	es
 29269                                  	;push	cs
 29270                                  	;pop	es
 29271                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 29272                                  	;pop	es
 29273                                  
 29274                                  	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 29275                                  
 29276                                  	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 29277                                  
 29278                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 29279                                  	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 29280                                  	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 29281                                  
 29282                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29283                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29284                                  
 29285                                  	call	parseL
 29286                                  	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 29287                                  
 29288                                  	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 29289                                  	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 29290                                  
 29291                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 29292                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29293                                  pvErr:	dec	si
 29294                                  	dec	si
 29295                                  	stc
 29296                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 29297                                  	pop	es
 29298                                  	pop	ds
 29299                                  	pop	di
 29300                                  	retn
 29301                                  
 29302                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29303                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 29304                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29305                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
